translated: Otherwise, they would be the teachers,

original: yang dag par sdud par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par sdud par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: not the compilers.

original: de nyid ni yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: That itself is the cause of conviction,

original: gzhan du na mi srid pa'i don smras na yid ches par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na mi srid pa'i don smras na yid ches par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if one were to speak of an impossible meaning, it would not be convincing.

original: yang na thos zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag nyid 'chad pa po dgag pa ste /
analyzed: yang na thos zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag nyid 'chad pa po dgag pa ste /
translated: Or else, the word “heard” excludes the self as the speaker.

original: gzungs 'di yid brten du rung bas gsungs par ston te /
analyzed: gzungs 'di yid brten du rung bas gsungs par ston te /
translated: This shows that the teaching is reliable,

original: bdag ni de'i @125a * //
analyzed: bdag ni de'i @125a * //
translated: because it is said that “at that time, I was the one who heard it.”

original: tshe na nyen par zad kyi 'chad pa po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshe na nyen par zad kyi 'chad pa po ni ma yin te /
translated: This shows that the speaker was not the Buddha,

original: 'chad pa po ni bcom ldan 'das so zhes ston pa'i phyir ro //🔽'o na yang dag par sdud pa sdud par byed pas /
analyzed: 'chad pa po ni bcom ldan 'das so zhes ston pa'i phyir ro // 'o na yang dag par sdud pa sdud par byed pas /
translated: because the speaker was the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
translated: But why didn’t the compiler, the compiler of the correct teaching, say, “The Blessed One taught this”?

original: de skad ces smras pa la yon tan lhag pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa la yon tan lhag pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the special quality of saying “I heard”?

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is to show that it was the Blessed One who taught it,

original: zhe na / ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis kyang de bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis kyang de bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: because the words “I heard” also show that.

original: ji skad gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad gong du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as explained above.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal pa zhes smras na ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos ba ma yin par bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal pa zhes smras na ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos ba ma yin par bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were said, “The Bhagavat spoke thus,” it would be taught that the compiler himself did not hear it directly.

original: de'i phyir thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las 'ongs pa'i tshig yin par dgos shing yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i tshig la su yang yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las 'ongs pa'i tshig yin par dgos shing yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i tshig la su yang yid ches par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be necessary that the words come from a succession of oral transmissions, and no one would believe the words of the compiler.

original: 'on te de'i phyir bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'di dang gzhan yang smos na ni de'i tshe tshig mangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de'i phyir bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'di dang gzhan yang smos na ni de'i tshe tshig mangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were said, “I heard this from him and from others,” then the words would be too many.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis kyang brjod par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis kyang brjod par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it were said, “Thus have I heard,” just that much would be sufficient to complete the meaning intended to be expressed, and the words “the Bhagavat spoke” would be redundant.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la sogs pa'i mdo las 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis yang dag par bsdu ba byos shig ces lung phog go //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la sogs pa'i mdo las 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis yang dag par bsdu ba byos shig ces lung phog go //
translated: Therefore, the Lord also gave the transmission in the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra and so on, saying, “You should compile the words ‘Thus have I heard’ and so on.”

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi lung dang mthun bar yang dag par sdud par byed pas de bzhin du yang dag par bsdu ba byas par 'gyur te rgol ba 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi lung dang mthun bar yang dag par sdud par byed pas de bzhin du yang dag par bsdu ba byas par 'gyur te rgol ba 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the compiler, in accordance with the transmission of the Lord, would compile it in that way, and this objection is not appropriate.

original: gzhan dag gis 'dir lan du smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'dir lan du smras pa /
translated: Others say in response to this:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gcig la sems can gyi mos pa sna tshogs kyi dbang gis rnam pa du mar bshad par snang ba'i shes pa skye bas 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gcig la sems can gyi mos pa sna tshogs kyi dbang gis rnam pa du mar bshad par snang ba'i shes pa skye bas 'di ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: The cognition that arises from the power of the various inclinations of sentient beings toward a single statement of the Lord appears as if it were explained in many ways. Therefore, it is not appropriate to say, “The Lord said this.”

original: de bas bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: de bas bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: Therefore, with the words “I heard this,”

original: yang dag par sdud par byed pas bdag nyid kyis thos pa'i lam nas 'ongs pa'i rim pa ston pas bcom ldan 'das @125b kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: yang dag par sdud par byed pas bdag nyid kyis thos pa'i lam nas 'ongs pa'i rim pa ston pas bcom ldan 'das @125b kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes mi brjod de /
translated: Since the compiler is not the speaker, he does not say “thus have I heard” because he is not teaching the stages of the path that he has heard.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is not the domain of the teaching of the Bhagavat.

original: de bas na mjug tu de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes brjod kyi 'di skad bka' stsal to zhes ni ma brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na mjug tu de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes brjod kyi 'di skad bka' stsal to zhes ni ma brjod do //
translated: Therefore, he says “thus it was said” at the end, but he does not say “thus have I heard.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni yi ge dang nges pa'i tshig tu brjod pas cung zad kyang ma bshad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni yi ge dang nges pa'i tshig tu brjod pas cung zad kyang ma bshad de /
translated: The Bhagavat does not teach even the slightest thing by means of letters and definitions.

original: de ni dus thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dus thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is always nonconceptual.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang tsam gyis sems can rnams la de ltar chos ston par snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang tsam gyis sems can rnams la de ltar chos ston par snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The Bhagavat appears to sentient beings to teach the Dharma by means of his blessing.

original: de bas na yang dag par sdud par byed pa nyid la rab tu snang ba dang mthun par thos pa thos zhes bya bar smras kyi /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par sdud par byed pa nyid la rab tu snang ba dang mthun par thos pa thos zhes bya bar smras kyi /
translated: Therefore, the compiler says “I have heard” in accordance with what he has seen and heard.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal pa zhes pa ni ma smras te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal pa zhes pa ni ma smras te /
translated: The phrase “the Bhagavat spoke thus” is not spoken,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yi ge 'bru gcig kyang ma bshad pa'i phyir ro zhe 'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yi ge 'bru gcig kyang ma bshad pa'i phyir ro zhe 'o //
translated: because the Bhagavat did not speak a single syllable.

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: That is not correct.

original: gal te yang dag par sdud par byed pas rang gis thos pa'i lam nas 'ongs sam /
analyzed: gal te yang dag par sdud par byed pas rang gis thos pa'i lam nas 'ongs sam /
translated: If the compiler were to say that he heard the teaching from the path of his own ear,

original: rang la snang ba tsam las 'ongs so zhes bstan na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: rang la snang ba tsam las 'ongs so zhes bstan na ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na ma yin te /
translated: or that it came from his own mere appearance, then it would not be the word of the Bhagavat.

original: de'i tshe mdo sde 'di zhal nas gsungs pa nyid du bstan par byas pa ma yin pas ma nyan pa'i skye bo dag 'di la gus par mi skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mdo sde 'di zhal nas gsungs pa nyid du bstan par byas pa ma yin pas ma nyan pa'i skye bo dag 'di la gus par mi skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would not be taught that this sutra was spoken from his mouth, and those who did not hear it would not develop respect for it.

original: gal te 'di bdag la snang ba dang mthun par bstan na ni de la de bzhin du snang ba ma skyes pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di bdag la snang ba dang mthun par bstan na ni de la de bzhin du snang ba ma skyes pa ni ma yin na /
translated: If it were taught in accordance with his own appearance, then it would not be the case that the appearance of that sutra did not arise in him.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes kyang ci'i phyir ma bstan /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes kyang ci'i phyir ma bstan /
translated: In that case, why would it not be taught that the Bhagavat spoke thus?

original: 'on te 'chad par snang ba med na ni de thos so snyam pa'i snang ba'ang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'chad par snang ba med na ni de thos so snyam pa'i snang ba'ang mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not appear to be explained, then the appearance of the thought “I hear it” would not occur.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos ston to //
translated: The Bhagavat teaches the Dharma.🔽The Bhagavat spoke thus, etc. Why does the compiler state what he himself has said?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang dag par sdud par byed pas ci'i phyir brjod pa smos shig / gal te gzhan dag dam pa'i chos la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rang la snang ba dang mthun par🔽'di skad smras so zhe na ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang dag par sdud par byed pas ci'i phyir brjod pa smos shig / gal te gzhan dag dam pa'i chos la gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rang la snang ba dang mthun par 'di skad smras so zhe na ni /
translated: If he said it in accordance with his own appearance in order to generate respect for the true Dharma in others,🔽then why did he not say at the beginning, “The Bhagavat spoke thus”?

original: gal te de lta na de bzhin du dang por yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal pa zhes ci'i phyir ma brjod gzhan du na sngar ni rang la snang ba tsam gyis bshad par bsgrubs la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na de bzhin du dang por yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal pa zhes ci'i phyir ma brjod gzhan du na sngar ni rang la snang ba tsam gyis bshad par bsgrubs la /
translated: Otherwise, at first he established the explanation by his own appearance alone,

original: phyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad bka' stsal to zhes mjug tu bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal par bsgrub na ltag 'og 'gal @126a * //
analyzed: phyis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad bka' stsal to zhes mjug tu bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal par bsgrub na ltag 'og 'gal @126a * //
translated: and later he established the conclusion by the Bhagavat’s statement, “The Bhagavat spoke thus.” But this is contradictory.

original: bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it is translated in the middle.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal ces bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis ni bsnan pa med par bye brag cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bka' stsal ba zhes bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal ces bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis ni bsnan pa med par bye brag cung zad kyang med de /
translated: The two phrases, “The Blessed One spoke thus” and “The Blessed One having spoken thus,” are not at all different, except that one is added to the other.

original: yang dag par sdud par byed pas bdag la snang ba tsam dang mthun pas tshig gnyi ga la bsnan pa dang bcas pas tshig sbyar kyang cung zad kyang mi 'gal na /
analyzed: yang dag par sdud par byed pas bdag la snang ba tsam dang mthun pas tshig gnyi ga la bsnan pa dang bcas pas tshig sbyar kyang cung zad kyang mi 'gal na /
translated: The compiler, in accordance with his own perception, has added the two phrases to the text, and there is no contradiction at all.

original: gang gis na mjug tu de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: gang gis na mjug tu de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Why then does he say, “At the end, he spoke thus”?🔽Why does he not say, “Thus he spoke”?

original: 'di skad bka' stsal to zhes ni ma brjod do zhes bya ba yang khungs su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bka' stsal to zhes ni ma brjod do zhes bya ba yang khungs su mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is not a reliable source.

original: de bas na 'di ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, this is not acceptable in any way.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig gi tshe 'am 'khor 'dus pa na 'di thos so zhes gong ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni dus gcig gi tshe 'am 'khor 'dus pa na 'di thos so zhes gong ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: “At one time” means “at one time” or “at one time when the assembly gathered, I heard this.” This is connected with the previous.

original: 'dis ni chos 'di thos par dka' bar ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni chos 'di thos par dka' bar ston te /
translated: This shows that it is difficult to hear this Dharma.

original: thams cad du thams cad kyis 'di 'dra ba'i chos thos par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad kyis 'di 'dra ba'i chos thos par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not possible for everyone to hear such a Dharma everywhere.

original: yang na bdag nyid mang du bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid mang du bstan pa ste ;
translated: Or else, it is a teaching of the greatness of the self,

original: dus gzhan na ni gzhan yang thos par ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus gzhan na ni gzhan yang thos par ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it shows that at another time, he heard other teachings.

original: dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs zhes bya ba 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs zhes bya ba 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: At one time the Lord was dwelling, as it is said below.

original: 'dis ni 'dul ba'i dgos pa mtha' yas pas dus gzhan na ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan na bzhugs su so zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dul ba'i dgos pa mtha' yas pas dus gzhan na ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan na bzhugs su so zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that at another time, the Lord was dwelling elsewhere, because the needs of those to be trained are limitless.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i sgo nas byung bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i sgo nas byung bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The word Lord shows that he is the one who has come forth by way of the expression of the Tathagata's qualities,

original: gzhan la yon tan 'di lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yon tan 'di lta bu mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because such qualities are impossible for others.

original: de la bdud bzhi bcom pa'am dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: de la bdud bzhi bcom pa'am dbang phyug la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: There, he is the Lord because he has conquered the four demons or because he possesses the qualities of the Lord, etc.

original: dbang dang rab tu ldan pa dang // gzugs dang dpal dang grags pa dang // ye shes dang ni nan tan dang // drug dang rab tu ldan phyir ro //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang dang rab tu ldan pa dang // gzugs dang dpal dang grags pa dang // ye shes dang ni nan tan dang // drug dang rab tu ldan phyir ro // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: knowledge, and practice.

original: yang na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: yang na srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa dang bral ba'am /
translated: Or else, he is the Blessed One because he is free from existence and nirvāṇa,

original: srid pa'i 'gro ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'gro ba las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because he has transcended the destinies of existence.

original: yang na mi 'jigs pa bzhi thob nas 'jigs pa ma lus pa dang bral bas nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na mi 'jigs pa bzhi thob nas 'jigs pa ma lus pa dang bral bas nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ste /
translated: Or else, he is the Blessed One because, having attained the four forms of fearlessness, he is free from all fear, according to the method of etymology.

original: 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo las //
analyzed: 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i mdo las //
translated: As it says in the noble Wheel of Brahmā Sūtra:

original: nam mkha' 'dra ba'i chos dag ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'dra ba'i chos dag ni //
translated: The Dharma is like space,

original: lus can rnams la rab ston kyang //
analyzed: lus can rnams la rab ston kyang //
translated: and he teaches it to embodied beings.

original: 'di la 'jigs pa med pa ste //
analyzed: 'di la 'jigs pa med pa ste //
translated: He has no fear here,

original: @126b de bas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: @126b de bas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: so he is called the Blessed One.

original: rgyal po'i khab ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab ces bya ba ni /
translated: In the Rājagṛha

original: grong khyer gyi khyad par gyi ming ste /
analyzed: grong khyer gyi khyad par gyi ming ste /
translated: the name of a particular city.

original: sngon rgyal po'i ming khang ba'i ming du btags pas mi ma yin pa dag gis ma gtses pas de skad btags zhes grag ste /
analyzed: sngon rgyal po'i ming khang ba'i ming du btags pas mi ma yin pa dag gis ma gtses pas de skad btags zhes grag ste /
translated: It is said that in the past, because the king's name was given to the house, non-humans did not harm it, so it was named thus.

original: de bas na grong khyer de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na grong khyer de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that city is called by that name.

original: 'di ni grong khyer thams cad kyi mchog yin pas na der bshad pas de bzhin du mdo sde 'di yang mdo sde thams cad kyi mchog tu ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni grong khyer thams cad kyi mchog yin pas na der bshad pas de bzhin du mdo sde 'di yang mdo sde thams cad kyi mchog tu ston to //
translated: Since this is the best of all cities, by explaining it there, this sutra is also shown to be the best of all sutras.

original: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum gyis bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum gyis bzhugs pa ste /
translated: Abides means abides in three ways:

original: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang / chos 'chad cing bzhugs pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa dang / chos 'chad cing bzhugs pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: abiding in deportment, abiding in explaining the Dharma, and abiding in correct meditative equipoise.

original: khams gsum pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa ston to //
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa ston to //
translated: By in all three realms and so on, it shows abiding in correct meditative equipoise.

original: 'dir sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir yid dang bar byed pas na khang bzangs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir yid dang bar byed pas na khang bzangs zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, because it is free from all the stains of obscurations, it is called mansion because it delights the mind.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That is the inconceivable concentration of the Tathagata.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po ni khang pa gang la snying por yod pa de la de skad ces bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po ni khang pa gang la snying por yod pa de la de skad ces bshad de /
translated: The essence of the non-conceptual ultimate realm is the palace, and that which has an essence is explained as such.

original: de rtogs pas gnas pa'i phyir de nyid de'i snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pas gnas pa'i phyir de nyid de'i snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is realized, it is the essence of that.

original: zag pa med pas khams gsum las 'das pa'i phyir de ni khams gsum pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yang yin la rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po yang yin no zhes bsdu'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pas khams gsum las 'das pa'i phyir de ni khams gsum pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yang yin la rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po yang yin no zhes bsdu'o //
translated: It is also the essence of the non-conceptual ultimate realm, which is superior to all three realms because it transcends the three realms without contamination.

original: yang na khang pa ni gnas kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: yang na khang pa ni gnas kyi khyad par te /
translated: Or, the palace is a special abode,

original: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung bas khams gsum gyi sred pa dag gis bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung bas khams gsum gyi sred pa dag gis bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir /
translated: and because it arises from supramundane roots of virtue, it is not appropriated by the craving of the three realms.

original: khams gsum na de lta bu gzhan med pas khams gsum pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum na de lta bu gzhan med pas khams gsum pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is nothing else like it in the three realms, it is said to be superior to all of the three realms.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po las byung ba'i gnas de la de skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po las byung ba'i gnas de la de skad ces bshad do //
translated: It is called the “essence of the nonconceptual realm of reality” because it arises from the realization of the realm of reality.

original: de yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zab cing rgya che ba gzhal du med pas rnam par sbyangs pa'i ye shes kyi mig can byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul te /🔽dman pa la mos pa mig ser gyi nad kyis thebs pa lta bu'i ye shes kyi @127a * //
analyzed: de yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zab cing rgya che ba gzhal du med pas rnam par sbyangs pa'i ye shes kyi mig can byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul te / dman pa la mos pa mig ser gyi nad kyis thebs pa lta bu'i ye shes kyi @127a * //
translated: It is the domain of bodhisattvas who have the eye of wisdom that is purified by the profound and vast accumulations of merit and wisdom, which are beyond measure.

original: mig can nyan thos la sogs pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig can nyan thos la sogs pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the domain of those whose wisdom-eye is afflicted by the jaundice of inferior aspirations, such as the śrāvakas and so on.

original: de bas na nyan thos kyi mdo sde bstan pa las ni rnam pa 'di lta bu ma gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos kyi mdo sde bstan pa las ni rnam pa 'di lta bu ma gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, this kind of teaching is not found in the sūtras of the śrāvakas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'byor pa'i rnam pa thams cad la dman pa la mos pa'i sems can rnams kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mos par mi nus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'byor pa'i rnam pa thams cad la dman pa la mos pa'i sems can rnams kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mos par mi nus te /
translated: The Blessed One's entire wealth of perfections cannot be fully appreciated by beings who are devoted to the inferior vehicle.

original: de bas na mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi bsam pa dang 'tsham par nyan thos la sogs pa dag la bcom ldan 'das nyid kyang spyod pa chung du ston to //
analyzed: de bas na mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi bsam pa dang 'tsham par nyan thos la sogs pa dag la bcom ldan 'das nyid kyang spyod pa chung du ston to //
translated: Therefore, in accordance with their devotion, the Blessed One himself teaches the lesser vehicle to the śrāvakas, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni rgya chen po yang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni rgya chen po yang mi 'gal lo //
translated: But for the bodhisattvas, the great vehicle is not contradictory.

original: gnas dben pa 'di bstan pas kyang bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gnas dben pa 'di bstan pas kyang bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This teaching on the secluded abode also shows that the Blessed One dwells in right contemplation.

original: rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs pas ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab na bzhugs pas ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to /
translated: His dwelling in Rājagṛha shows his perfection of the aims of others.

original: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par der bzhugs so //
analyzed: bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par der bzhugs so //
translated: He dwells there for the perfection of his own and others' aims.

original: de bas na yul gyi khyad par kho na brjod kyi /
analyzed: de bas na yul gyi khyad par kho na brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, only the particular place is mentioned,

original: dus kyi khyad par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par ni ma yin te /
translated: not the particular time.

original: 'di ltar yul gyi khyad par brjod pas ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul gyi khyad par brjod pas ni /
translated: By mentioning the particular place,

original: de na bcom ldan 'das chos 'chad pas bzhugs pa dang / spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de na bcom ldan 'das chos 'chad pas bzhugs pa dang / spyod lam gyis bzhugs pa bstan to //
translated: it is shown that the Lord is seated expounding the Dharma and seated in the right posture.

original: bzhugs pa gnyis pos ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don mdzad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhugs pa gnyis pos ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don mdzad par shes par bya'o //
translated: By the two seated postures, it should be understood that the Lord is engaged in the welfare of others.

original: 'di ltar chos 'chad cing bzhugs pas ni /🔽yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / gzings bstod pa dang / rab tu dga' bar mdzad pas ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba las bkrol te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'chad cing bzhugs pas ni / yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / gzings bstod pa dang / rab tu dga' bar mdzad pas ngan 'gro dang 'khor ba las bkrol te /
translated: Thus, by being seated expounding the Dharma,

original: bde 'gro dang theg pa gsum la rab tu bkod pas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi don dpag tu med pa mdzad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang theg pa gsum la rab tu bkod pas bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi don dpag tu med pa mdzad par shes par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the Lord is engaged in the welfare of innumerable beings, by rescuing them from evil destinies and cyclic existence, through teaching, through causing them to take up, through encouraging them, and through gladdening them, and by establishing them in good destinies and in the three vehicles.

original: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pas kyang bsod snyoms la rgyu ba la sogs pas na grong gi bud med dang / rgan po dang / nad pa dang / dbul po la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das la bsod snyoms la sogs cung zad kyang phul bas kyang bsod nams dpag tu med pa rab tu 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod lam gyis bzhugs pas kyang bsod snyoms la rgyu ba la sogs pas na grong gi bud med dang / rgan po dang / nad pa dang / dbul po la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das la bsod snyoms la sogs cung zad kyang phul bas kyang bsod nams dpag tu med pa rab tu 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And by his conduct, he is a beggar, and so on. Therefore, by the Blessed One's receiving a little almsfood from a village woman, an old man, a sick person, a poor person, and so on, they all increase their merit immeasurably.

original: ngo mtshar sna tshogs rgyun du bstan pas long ba la sogs pas ni mig la sogs pa 'thob pa dang / ma dad pa rnams kyi dad pa bskyed pa dang / dad pa rnams kyi dad pa 'phel bar bya ba'i @127b phyir te ;
analyzed: ngo mtshar sna tshogs rgyun du bstan pas long ba la sogs pas ni mig la sogs pa 'thob pa dang / ma dad pa rnams kyi dad pa bskyed pa dang / dad pa rnams kyi dad pa 'phel bar bya ba'i @127b phyir te ;
translated: And by his constantly displaying various miracles, the blind, and so on, obtain their sight, and so on; the faithless generate faith, and the faithful increase their faith.

original: mdo ste las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo ste las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: As it is said in the sutra.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bzhugs pa gnyis kyis ni gzhan gyi don dpag tu med pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bzhugs pa gnyis kyis ni gzhan gyi don dpag tu med pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: By these two activities of the Blessed One, his benefit for others should be understood as immeasurable.

original: dus kyi khyad par brjod pas ni phun sum tshogs pa gang yang mi ston pas de bas na de ni gang du yang ma smos te /
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par brjod pas ni phun sum tshogs pa gang yang mi ston pas de bas na de ni gang du yang ma smos te /
translated: Since the specification of time does not indicate any perfection, it is not mentioned anywhere.

original: yang dang yang gzhan du 'gyur bas dus la nges pa med de /
analyzed: yang dang yang gzhan du 'gyur bas dus la nges pa med de /
translated: Time is not definite because it changes from one moment to another,

original: brtag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is difficult to determine.

original: skad cig ma gcig la yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskal pa dang / zhag dang / zla ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba du ma ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bskal pa dang / zhag dang / zla ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba du ma ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even in a single moment, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas can display many divisions of eons, days, months, and so on.

original: de bas na dus la nges pa bya bar mi nus pas gang du yang ma smos so //
analyzed: de bas na dus la nges pa bya bar mi nus pas gang du yang ma smos so //
translated: Therefore, since it is not possible to specify time, it is not mentioned anywhere.

original: gzhan dag gis lan du smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis lan du smras pa /
translated: Others reply:

original: dus de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: dus de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: At that very time,

original: bcom ldan 'das yul gzhan du yang snang bas yul tha dad pa nas lhags pa rnams dus kyi khyad par brjod pa na de'i tshe na ni bcom ldan 'das nged kyi drung na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yul gzhan du yang snang bas yul tha dad pa nas lhags pa rnams dus kyi khyad par brjod pa na de'i tshe na ni bcom ldan 'das nged kyi drung na bzhugs so //
translated: the Blessed One appeared in another place. Those who came from different places, when they spoke of the difference in time, said, “At that time, the Blessed One was in our presence.”

original: nged kyi drung na bzhugs so zhes rtsod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nged kyi drung na bzhugs so zhes rtsod par 'gyur te /
translated: They argued, “He was in our presence.”

original: de bas na dus kyi nges pa ni ma byas so zhe'o //
analyzed: de bas na dus kyi nges pa ni ma byas so zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, the time is not fixed.🔽What is the use of mentioning the particular place? Tell us why there is no dispute.

original: de la yul gyi khyad par 'di smas pas ci'i phyir rtsed par mi 'gyur ba smros shig / de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das yul gzhan na yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yul gyi khyad par 'di smas pas ci'i phyir rtsed par mi 'gyur ba smros shig / de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das yul gzhan na yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Lord appears in other places at the same time.

original: 'on te bcom ldan 'das kyi mthu'i khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mos pas de dag der rtsod par mi 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'on te bcom ldan 'das kyi mthu'i khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mos pas de dag der rtsod par mi 'gyur na ni /
translated: But if you believe that the Lord’s power is inconceivable, then there would be no dispute.

original: de lta na gang dus la yang nges par mi 'gyur te 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: de lta na gang dus la yang nges par mi 'gyur te 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: In that case, the time is not fixed. This is a useless argument.

original: nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pas ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog la bzhugs pas ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The Lord’s abiding in the inner contemplation shows the perfection of his own aim.

original: don gnyis phun sum tshogs pa'i ston pa la ni skyabs su 'gro bar rigs pa'o //
analyzed: don gnyis phun sum tshogs pa'i ston pa la ni skyabs su 'gro bar rigs pa'o //
translated: It is proper to go for refuge to the teacher who is perfect in the two aims.

original: des gsungs pa'i lung ni mi slu bas tshad mar rigs te /
analyzed: des gsungs pa'i lung ni mi slu bas tshad mar rigs te /
translated: His scriptures are proper as valid cognitions because they are non-deceptive.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa gnyi ga smos so //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa gnyi ga smos so //
translated: Therefore, both perfections are mentioned in order to generate respect for the Lord’s scriptures.

original: yang 'di la dbang su yod snyam pa la /
analyzed: yang 'di la dbang su yod snyam pa la /
translated: Again, thinking, “Who has power over this?”

original: chen po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “great,”

original: nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong ngo //
translated: because they have destroyed the afflictions, they are bhikṣus.

original: de dag 'dus pa la bdud la sogs pas dbyer mi phyed de 'dus pas na dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa la bdud la sogs pas dbyer mi phyed de 'dus pas na dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are not divided by Māra, etc., in their assembly, they are called saṃgha, “assembly.”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A great host of bodhisattvas”

original: thabs cig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //🔽de dag ni sems @128a * //🔽can rnams la khong du chud par byed pa'am /🔽byang chub la 'jog pa'am /
analyzed: thabs cig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro // de dag ni sems @128a * // can rnams la khong du chud par byed pa'am / byang chub la 'jog pa'am /
translated: is to be connected with “together with.”🔽They are bodhisattvas because they have the thought of awakening

original: byang chub sems dpas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: or because they are established in awakening.

original: de dag gi tshogs ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi tshogs ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: Their host is their assembly.

original: tshogs gnyi ga yang grangs dang yon tan gnyis kyi chen po'o //🔽theg pa chen po la yang nyan thos rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshogs gnyi ga yang grangs dang yon tan gnyis kyi chen po'o // theg pa chen po la yang nyan thos rnams 'jug par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Both hosts are great in terms of both number and quality.🔽In order to show that even the śrāvakas enter into the Mahāyāna,

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde bshad pa la nyan thos rnams kyang bshad kyi /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde bshad pa la nyan thos rnams kyang bshad kyi /
translated: the śrāvakas are also explained in the explanations of the Mahāyāna sūtras.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyan thos kyi mdo ste bshad pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nyan thos kyi mdo ste bshad pa la ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are not in the sravaka sutras,

original: de dag der mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag der mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not enter there.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni rab tu byung bar 'dra ba dang / bya ba byas pa dang / bdag gi don lhur len na bas rtag tu bcom ldan 'das kyi zha 'bring byed pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams la gus pa bya bar brjod pa'i phyir gong du bstan to /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni rab tu byung bar 'dra ba dang / bya ba byas pa dang / bdag gi don lhur len na bas rtag tu bcom ldan 'das kyi zha 'bring byed pa dang / rab tu byung ba rnams la gus pa bya bar brjod pa'i phyir gong du bstan to /
translated: The bhiksu saṅgha is mentioned first because they are always in the presence of the Lord, and because they are monks and are devoted to their own goal, and because they are similar in being renunciates, and because they have done their duties, and because they are to be respected by renunciates.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ming brjod pa ni de dag mthu chen por grags pa dang / mdo sde yang de dag gi phyir bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ming brjod pa ni de dag mthu chen por grags pa dang / mdo sde yang de dag gi phyir bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas are mentioned by name in the phrase “such as these” because they are renowned for their great power, and because the sutra is explained for their sake.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ming ma brjod pa ni de dag de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ming ma brjod pa ni de dag de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sravakas are not mentioned by name because they are the opposite of that.

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Great being” means

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po bsgral ba'i phyir go cha bgos pa dang / blo che ba dang / gtong ba chen po dang ldan pa dang / mthu chen po'i phyir ro zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po bsgral ba'i phyir go cha bgos pa dang / blo che ba dang / gtong ba chen po dang ldan pa dang / mthu chen po'i phyir ro zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: He is a great being because he is armored for the sake of liberating the great multitude of sentient beings, because he has a great mind, because he has great generosity, and because he has great power.

original: yang na chos dang / sems bskyed pa dang / bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / tshogs dang / dus dang / yang dag par 'grub pa che bas na sems dpa' chen po'o //🔽de la chos chen po ni /
analyzed: yang na chos dang / sems bskyed pa dang / bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / tshogs dang / dus dang / yang dag par 'grub pa che bas na sems dpa' chen po'o // de la chos chen po ni /
translated: Alternatively, he is a great being because of the greatness of Dharma, the generation of mind, attitude, aspiration, the collections, time, and perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i chos rab tu rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa la sogs pa'i chos rab tu rgya che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of Dharma is due to the vastness of the Dharma of the perfection of wisdom in one hundred thousand verses, etc., of the bodhisattvas.

original: sems bskyed pa chen po ni de dag nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa chen po ni de dag nyid bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The greatness of the generation of mind is due to the generation of the mind of unsurpassed true and complete enlightenment by those very bodhisattvas.

original: bsam pa chen po ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bya bar sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa chen po ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba bya bar sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great resolve is the resolve to bring about the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: mos pa ni chen po ni zab cing rgya che ba'i chos la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa ni chen po ni zab cing rgya che ba'i chos la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great devotion is the devotion to the profound and the magnificent Dharma.

original: tshogs chen po ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po dpag tu med @128b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs chen po ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po dpag tu med @128b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great accumulation is the accumulation of merit and knowledge, which is immeasurable.

original: dus chen po ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du brtson 'grus brtsoms pas byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus chen po ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du brtson 'grus brtsoms pas byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great time is the time of the three incalculable aeons, because enlightenment is attained through the exertion of effort.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyis ni rgyu chen po bstan to //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyis ni rgyu chen po bstan to //
translated: All of these indicate the great cause.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa chen po 'dis ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa chen po 'dis ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The great perfect accomplishment is the result,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ni phyin ci log tu mi rtog pas rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir ro // rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ni phyin ci log tu mi rtog pas rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: because the attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment is due to that.🔽Nonconceptuality is the absence of conceptualization, because it is not the opposite of conceptualization.

original: log par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par rtog pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the abandonment of wrong conceptualization.

original: 'di la 'dis rnam par ma brtags pas na rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'dis rnam par ma brtags pas na rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: It is non-conceptual because it does not investigate this or that.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is reality and right knowledge.

original: des de thob pas /
analyzed: des de thob pas /
translated: Since one attains it,

original: snang zhing gsal bas na rnam par mi rtog snang ba'o //
analyzed: snang zhing gsal bas na rnam par mi rtog snang ba'o //
translated: it is the light of non-conceptuality, because it illuminates and manifests.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni zla ba bzhin du bsal bar byed pas na rnam par mi rtog zla ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni zla ba bzhin du bsal bar byed pas na rnam par mi rtog zla ba'o //
translated: It is the moon of non-conceptuality, because non-conceptuality is like the moon, illuminating.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dbang thob pa'i phyir de la dpa' bas na rnam par rtog med dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dbang thob pa'i phyir de la dpa' bas na rnam par rtog med dpa' ba'o //
translated: It is the hero of non-conceptuality, because one attains mastery over non-conceptual knowledge.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos theg pa chen po des mngon sum dang brgyud de bshad pa'i phyir de ston pa la mkhas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos theg pa chen po des mngon sum dang brgyud de bshad pa'i phyir de ston pa la mkhas pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is the skill in teaching that, taking non-conceptuality as the basis, teaches the non-conceptual Dharma of the Great Vehicle, directly and indirectly.

original: rnam par rtog med ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med ngo bo nyid //
translated: It is the nature of non-conceptuality.

original: ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it becomes the essence of non-conceptual knowledge.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dbang thob pas na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes la dbang thob pas na /
translated: And by gaining mastery of nonconceptual gnosis,🔽

original: rnam par rtog med dbang phyug go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the lord of nonconceptual intuition, because he has attained mastery of nonconceptual intuition.

original: rnam par mi rtog cing dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa chen po la dbang ste dbang thob pas na rnam par rtog med byams pa che po'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog cing dmigs pa med pa'i byams pa chen po la dbang ste dbang thob pas na rnam par rtog med byams pa che po'i dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the lord of great nonconceptual love, because he has attained mastery of great nonconceptual, nonapprehending love.

original: thugs brtse bas skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa'i sems can thams cad la gzigs pa'i dbang po ste dbang thob pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
analyzed: thugs brtse bas skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa'i sems can thams cad la gzigs pa'i dbang po ste dbang thob pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the lord of the vision of compassion, because he has attained mastery of the eye of compassion that sees all sentient beings, both those who have the fortune to be helped and those who do not.

original: ming lhag ma rnams ni khong du chud par sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: ming lhag ma rnams ni khong du chud par sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The remaining names are easy to understand and do not need to be analyzed.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i ming don dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na'i ming brjod pa ni de dag gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i ming don dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kho na'i ming brjod pa ni de dag gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te //
translated: Only the names of those bodhisattvas who have the meaning of the names as they have been explained are mentioned, because they are the principal ones.

original: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa las brtsams nas chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par mi rtog pa las brtsams nas chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, he taught the Dharma beginning with nonconceptuality.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa rid du spangs pa dag kho nas dam pa'i chos 'di mnyan pa dang mos par nus te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa rid du spangs pa dag kho nas dam pa'i chos 'di mnyan pa dang mos par nus te /
translated: Only those who have completely abandoned the discursive thoughts of improper mental activity are able to listen to and believe in this holy Dharma,🔽not others.

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan @129a * //🔽pa'i phyir ro //🔽gleng gzhi bshad zin to //🔽gleng bslang ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan @129a * // pa'i phyir ro // gleng gzhi bshad zin to // gleng bslang ba ste /
translated: This is what is taught.🔽The Introduction

translated: in order to generate respect.

analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa nyid las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i chos las 'das pa ste /
translated: Beginning with the non-conceptuality of phenomena means that all phenomena are beyond existence, non-existence, etc.

original: de bas na rnam par mi rtog pa ni brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par mi rtog pa ni brjod du med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, non-conceptuality is inexpressible.

analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos nyid de brjod pa'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: The Dharma is taught in order to express the non-conceptual reality of phenomena.

original: skabs 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: skabs 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde 'di gsungs so //
translated: In this context, the Blessed One taught this sutra.

original: de bas na ji skad gsungs pa'i chos ston pa na 'khor snod du rung bar mkhyen nas gzungs 'di nyan du gzhug pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //

translated: Therefore, when teaching the Dharma as it is taught, knowing that the retinue is a suitable vessel, the Blessed One causes them to take up this dharani in order to listen to it.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the taking up of the correct view,

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said Then the Blessed One... and so on.

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni skabs rgyun chags pa'o //
translated: Then refers to the continuous context.

analyzed: 'khor la kun du gzigs pa ni 'chad par bzhed pa bstan pa'am /
translated: Looking out at the retinue indicates the intention to explain,

translated: If one says It is not reasonable to say 'looking' because the Blessed One is always in equipoise,

analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa mkhyen pa dang khyad par mdzad pas de'i phyir rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid de /

original: 'di ni ji na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ji na'o //
translated: This is how it is.

analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa 'di yang tshig gis 'jug par mdzad pa dang / 'bras bu bstan pas so //

analyzed: zung shig ces bya ba ni tshig gis 'jug par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Take hold of it is the verbal engagement.

analyzed: bzung ba de yang tshig dang don dang bsgrub pas so //
translated: That taking hold is by means of words, meanings, and practice.

analyzed: de bzung na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'bras bu bstan pas so ;
translated: The teaching of the result is by means of if you take hold of that and so on.

translated: That result is also

analyzed: ring ba ni sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'o //
translated: The distant is the attainment of buddhahood.

analyzed: nye ba ni gang mos pas spyod pa dang / sa la 'jug pa na gong nas gong du dus thams cad du mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par 'thob pa'o //
translated: The near is the attainment of the distinctive qualities of superknowledge and so on at all times, from the stage of devoted engagement up to the stages.

original: myur ba myur bar zhes bya @129b ba ni skyen pa skyen par ro //
analyzed: myur ba myur bar zhes bya @129b ba ni skyen pa skyen par ro //
translated: Very quickly means quickly, quickly.

original: sgrub ces bya ba ni skyed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub ces bya ba ni skyed pa'o //
translated: To establish means to generate.

original: rtag tu khyad par du yang 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu khyad par du yang 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To always progress means to attain distinction, that is, to attain excellence.

original: kha cig tu ni 'di lta bus 'dul ba'i skye bo dag nye bar gyur pas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi yang dag par 'dzin du 'dzud do //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni 'di lta bus 'dul ba'i skye bo dag nye bar gyur pas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi yang dag par 'dzin du 'dzud do //
translated: In some places, the Blessed One himself causes them to take up the true Dharma, because there are beings there to be disciplined by such means.

original: kha cig tu ni zhus kyang mi 'chad de /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni zhus kyang mi 'chad de /
translated: In some places, he does not teach even when requested.

analyzed: de na de lta bu'i chos kyi snod du gyur pa med par shes par bya'o //
translated: There, it should be understood, there are no vessels for such a Dharma.

original: da ni gsol ba 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gsol ba 'debs pa ste /
translated: Now, the request:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then, etc.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das 'chad bzhed par shes na bcom ldan 'das la ci'i phyir gsol ba 'debs /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das 'chad bzhed par shes na bcom ldan 'das la ci'i phyir gsol ba 'debs /
translated: If it is known that the Blessed One wishes to teach, why is he requested by the bodhisattvas?

original: de nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: For that very reason,

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'chad pa bzhed par shes pa de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dag gsol ba 'debs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'chad pa bzhed par shes pa de nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' dag gsol ba 'debs te /
translated: Thus, it is precisely because one knows that the Lord wishes to explain that the Bodhisattvas request him.

original: ma gsol bar chos 'di lta bu mi 'chad de /
analyzed: ma gsol bar chos 'di lta bu mi 'chad de /
translated: He does not explain such a doctrine without being requested,

original: bcom ldan 'das dang / chos rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang / chos rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to proclaim the greatness of the Lord and of the doctrines.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par mi rtog snang ba des chos kyi dbyings nyid khong du chud pas gzungs kyi don rig tu zin kyang chos mnyan pas ngoms par mi bya'o zhes gzhan dag la bstan pa'i phyir gsol ba btab po //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par mi rtog snang ba des chos kyi dbyings nyid khong du chud pas gzungs kyi don rig tu zin kyang chos mnyan pas ngoms par mi bya'o zhes gzhan dag la bstan pa'i phyir gsol ba btab po //
translated: The Bodhisattva Vimalāmbaradhara, having understood the Dharma-dhātu itself through that non-conceptual appearance, has already understood the meaning of the dhāraṇī, but he requests the Lord to explain the dhāraṇī in order to teach others that one should not be satisfied with merely hearing the doctrine.

original: stan las langs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu ni bcom ldan 'das la gus par bya ba dang / 'di bzhin gsol ba thob shig par gzhan dag la bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stan las langs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu ni bcom ldan 'das la gus par bya ba dang / 'di bzhin gsol ba thob shig par gzhan dag la bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of rising from one’s seat and so forth is in order to show respect to the Lord and in order to show others that one should request the doctrine in this way.

original: thos nas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzungs bshad pa'i don chen po ston te /
analyzed: thos nas 'dzin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzungs bshad pa'i don chen po ston te /
translated: By this “having heard, one retains” he shows the great purpose of the explanation of the dhāraṇī.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the welfare of self and others.

original: tshul bzhin yid la bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni de'i don ji lta ba bzhin du bsam pa dang bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni de'i don ji lta ba bzhin du bsam pa dang bsgom pa'o //
translated: Proper mental attention is the contemplation and cultivation of its meaning just as it is.

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas ji ltar gzungs 'di bshad pas gzhan dag 'di la bdag dang gzhan gyi don chen po 'grub par 'gyur ba mkhyen mod kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas ji ltar gzungs 'di bshad pas gzhan dag 'di la bdag dang gzhan gyi don chen po 'grub par 'gyur ba mkhyen mod kyi /
translated: The Blessed One, the Omniscient One, indeed knows how this dhāraṇī, when explained, will accomplish the great welfare of self and others for others.

original: 'on kyang gsol ba ma btab pa la bcom ldan 'das don med par cung zad kyang mi 'chad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsol ba ma btab pa la bcom ldan 'das don med par cung zad kyang mi 'chad de /
translated: However, the Blessed One does not explain anything pointlessly without being requested.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las chos thos nas gzungs la sogs pa nan tan gyis sgrubs shig par gzhan dag la bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsol to //
translated: This request was made in order to show others that after hearing the Dharma from the Blessed One, they should practice dhāraṇī and so forth.🔽Having thus been requested, the Blessed One

original: de skad ces gsol ba btab pa la gnang bar dgongs nas /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba btab pa la gnang bar dgongs nas /
translated: contemplated granting permission.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @130a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @130a * //
translated: The Blessed One

original: 'khor snod du rung bar mdzad pa'i phyir bsdus pa'i don lnga pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor snod du rung bar mdzad pa'i phyir bsdus pa'i don lnga pa ste /
translated: in order to make the retinue suitable vessels, spoke the fifth condensed meaning:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore... and so forth.

original: nye bar sbyor ba 'di ni spyi yin pas rgyu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba 'di ni spyi yin pas rgyu bstan pa ste /
translated: This application is general, so it indicates the cause.

original: bshad do zhes bya ba'i tshig de dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bshad do zhes bya ba'i tshig de dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “explain” is connected with it.

original: yang na nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang ngo //🔽gal te khyed cag nyan pa la sogs pas sgrub na de'i phyir ngas bshad do zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: yang na nyon zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang ngo // gal te khyed cag nyan pa la sogs pas sgrub na de'i phyir ngas bshad do zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Or else, “listen” is connected with “etc.”🔽If you listen, etc., then I will explain.

original: gang gi phyir ngas bshad pa de'i phyir khyed cag nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngas bshad pa de'i phyir khyed cag nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, since I will explain, therefore you should listen, etc.

original: nyon la zhes bya ba ni rna blags te nyan du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nyon la zhes bya ba ni rna blags te nyan du 'jug pa'o //
translated: “Listen” means to make one open one’s ears and listen.

original: legs par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par 'dzin du gzhug ba'o ;
analyzed: legs par zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par 'dzin du gzhug ba'o ;
translated: “Well” means to make one apprehend without error.

original: / rab tu yid la zung shig ces bya ba ni kun du 'dzin du 'jug gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: / rab tu yid la zung shig ces bya ba ni kun du 'dzin du 'jug gzhug pa'o //
translated: “Take it to mind” means to make one apprehend completely.

original: 'dis ni snod khas phub pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / rdol ba lta bu dgag pa'i phyir go rims bzhin te 'khor snod du rung bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni snod khas phub pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / rdol ba lta bu dgag pa'i phyir go rims bzhin te 'khor snod du rung bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: This passage, respectively, rejects the vessel that is upside-down, dirty, or cracked, and makes the retinue a suitable vessel.

original: bshad do zhes bya ba ni de lta na ngas bshad kyis gzhan du snod khas phub pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / rdol ba la char bab pa dang 'dra na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad do zhes bya ba ni de lta na ngas bshad kyis gzhan du snod khas phub pa dang / mi gtsang ba dang / rdol ba la char bab pa dang 'dra na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase I will explain means that if it were like that, then my explanation would be meaningless, like rain falling on a pot with a hole in it, or on unclean ground.

original: yang na nga ni 'chad par zad de /
analyzed: yang na nga ni 'chad par zad de /
translated: Or else, the phrase I will explain means that I have finished explaining.

original: khyed rnams kyis mnyan pa dang gzung ba la sogs pa la nan tan gyis sgrubs shig par ston to //
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis mnyan pa dang gzung ba la sogs pa la nan tan gyis sgrubs shig par ston to //
translated: You should practice earnestly, listening, retaining, etc.

original: gzhan du na gal te bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis thams cad mdzad par gyur na ni de'i tshe yid du mi 'ong ba'i las la sogs pa'i sgrib pas sems can dmyal ba la sogs par su yang mi smin pa zhig na /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis thams cad mdzad par gyur na ni de'i tshe yid du mi 'ong ba'i las la sogs pa'i sgrib pas sems can dmyal ba la sogs par su yang mi smin pa zhig na /
translated: Otherwise, if the Lord were to do everything, then at that time no one would be ripened in the hells, etc. by the obscurations of unwholesome actions, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni thams cad mdzad par mi spyod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni thams cad mdzad par mi spyod do //
translated: But the Lord does not act in such a way that he does everything.

original: de lta bas na sems can de dag lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa la mi brten par bya ba'i phyir ci chos bstan par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na sems can de dag lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa la mi brten par bya ba'i phyir ci chos bstan par bya ba 'am /
translated: Therefore, in order that those sentient beings not rely on the unwholesome actions of body, etc., should I teach the Dharma?

original: 'on te de dag gi lus dang sems kyi tshul sgyur /
analyzed: 'on te de dag gi lus dang sems kyi tshul sgyur /
translated: Or, do you change the way their bodies and minds are?

original: lus la sogs pa ni rang gi gnas dang 'brel bar 'byung bas gzhan gyi lus la sogs pa'i dngos por bsgyur du btub mi srid do //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa ni rang gi gnas dang 'brel bar 'byung bas gzhan gyi lus la sogs pa'i dngos por bsgyur du btub mi srid do //
translated: Since bodies, etc. arise in connection with their own places, it is impossible to change them into the things of other bodies, etc.

original: de'i phyir chos rnams bsgyur du mi rung ba sems can rnams ni las bdag gir bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnams bsgyur du mi rung ba sems can rnams ni las bdag gir bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since phenomena cannot be changed, sentient beings are the owners of their karma.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'chad pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata teaches:

original: khyed cag nyid kyis sgrub par byos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyed cag nyid kyis sgrub par byos zhes gsungs so //
translated: You yourselves should accomplish it.

original: yang sman pas ma nyes sman gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: yang sman pas ma nyes sman gyis ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the fault of the doctor or the medicine,

original: nad pa de nyid @130b kyis ni nyes par gyur //
analyzed: nad pa de nyid @130b kyis ni nyes par gyur //
translated: but rather the fault of the patient himself.

original: ces gsungs so //

analyzed: nye bar len pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //

analyzed: de las byung ba'i phung po rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams so //

analyzed: mngon du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: 'dir yid la mi byed pa ni yid la byed pa med pa tsam ni ma yin te /

analyzed: med pa ni dngos po med pas gang gi rgyu'i dngos por yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the nonexistent is a non-entity, it is not tenable as the entity of a cause.

original: yid la byed pa de las gzhan yid la mi byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa de las gzhan yid la mi byed pa yang ma yin te /

analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gzhan gang ci yang rung ba dag kyang yid la mi byed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would follow that one could not attend to any other object whatsoever, such as form, etc.

original: de dag gi gnyen po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ni ma yin no //
translated: because that is not the antidote to those.

translated: Therefore, the non-attention that is incompatible with that attention, which has the characteristic of right conceptualization, is what is intended as non-attention.

analyzed: @131b mi mthun pa'i don gyis dgag pa gzung ba'i phyir mi mdza' ba dang brdzun pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because the meaning of incompatibility is taken as the negation. It is like an enemy, a lie, etc.

original: yang na yid la mi byed pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir yang dag par so sor rtog pa la yid la mi byed pa'i sgrar gdags pas brjod de 'bras bu tsam bstan pas kyang don gyi shugs kyis de la bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: yang na yid la mi byed pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir yang dag par so sor rtog pa la yid la mi byed pa'i sgrar gdags pas brjod de 'bras bu tsam bstan pas kyang don gyi shugs kyis de la bya bar mngon no //
translated: Or else, because non-attention is the result, correct analytical discrimination is designated by the word non-attention, since the mere result is taught, it is evident that the activity is in that.

original: de ltar na mtshan ma rnams yongs su spang bar nus te /
analyzed: de ltar na mtshan ma rnams yongs su spang bar nus te /
translated: Thus, one is able to abandon the signs.

translated: Thus, when the yogin discriminates the signs of form, etc., which appear through the power of ignorance by way of erroneous aspects, and does not apprehend them, then he abandons the manifest forms of attachment, etc.

original: / de dag rnam par spangs na mtshan ma med pa yang rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: / de dag rnam par spangs na mtshan ma med pa yang rab tu rtogs so //
translated: When they are abandoned, signlessness is also realized.

original: de skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las kyang ;

translated: “Thus, skilled in the faults, he practices yoga in the meditation on emptiness in order to be free from all conceptual elaborations.🔽Because he has a lot of meditation on emptiness, he investigates the nature of whatever object the mind enters and delights in.

analyzed: sems gang gis yongs su brtags pa de yang yongs su btsal na stong par rtogs so //
translated: He also understands the mind that investigates to be empty when he investigates it.

analyzed: de de ltar rtogs pas mtshan ma med pa la rnal 'byor du byed do zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las kyang //
translated: The noble Multitude of Jewels also says,

analyzed: tshul khrims la ni gnas nas ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob //
translated: “Having abided in morality, he attains meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob pas shes rab shin tu sgom //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams thob pas shes rab shin tu sgom //
translated: Through attaining the meditative concentrations, one cultivates insight.

original: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni ye shes rnam par dag pa 'thob // ces gsungs so //
translated: Through insight, one attains the purity of intuition.

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las kyang /
translated: And the noble Unraveling of the Intent says,

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par 'jil lo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par 'jil lo //
translated: “Meditative absorption conquers the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal yongs su spong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal yongs su spong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Insight eliminates their propensities.”

original: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the noble King of Meditative Absorptions says,

original: gal te chos la bdag med so sor rtog / so sor de brtags @132a * //
analyzed: gal te chos la bdag med so sor rtog / so sor de brtags @132a * //
translated: “If one analyzes the absence of a self in phenomena,

translated: and if one meditates on that analysis,

analyzed: de nyid mya ngan 'das thob 'bras bu'i rgyu //
translated: that is the cause for attaining the result of nirvana.

analyzed: rgyu gzhan gang yin des ni zhir mi 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Any other cause will not lead to peace.”

original: 'di nyid las kyang /

translated: And this very text says,

analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa de dag la nye bar brtags pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su 'jug ce na zhes 'og nas gsungs so //
translated: “How does one enter the nonconceptual realm by thoroughly investigating those abiding in the meditative concentrations?”

original: de lta bas na yang dag par so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dir yid la mi byed par dgongs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang dag par so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dir yid la mi byed par dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of correct analytical discrimination is considered here to be non-attention.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin mod kyi 'on kyang de nyid las byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi mes de bsreg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin mod kyi 'on kyang de nyid las byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi mes de bsreg par 'gyur te /
translated: Although it is the nature of discursive thought, it is burned up by the fire of correct direct intuition that arises from it.

original: shing gnyis drud pa las byung ba'i mes shing de gnyis sreg par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing gnyis drud pa las byung ba'i mes shing de gnyis sreg par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the fire that arises from the rubbing together of two sticks burning up those two sticks.

translated: Therefore, one who desires to generate non-discursive direct intuition should initially cultivate the vipaśyanā that has the characteristic of correct analytical discrimination.

original: des mtshan ma rnams yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des mtshan ma rnams yongs su spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of that, the signs are completely abandoned.

analyzed: de la rnal 'byor bas bsgom pa'i tshe thog mar bya ba ci yod pa thams cad zin par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, when the yogin is cultivating, he should first complete all that needs to be done.

translated: In a place that is free of the thorns of noise and is agreeable to the mind, one should manifest great compassion with the intention of liberating all beings without exception.

analyzed: phyogs thams cad bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag byas nas /

original: gzugs ri mor bris pa 'am gzhan yang rung ste mdun du gzhag la /
analyzed: gzugs ri mor bris pa 'am gzhan yang rung ste mdun du gzhag la /
translated: One should place in front of oneself a painted image or another [representation of the Buddha].

original: de dag la yang ci nus pas mchod de /
analyzed: de dag la yang ci nus pas mchod de /
translated: One should make offerings to them to the best of one's ability.

original: sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba byas nas /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba byas nas /
translated: One should confess one's sins and rejoice in the merit.

original: mig gnyis ha cang yang mi dbye bar sna'i rtse mor bltas la lus drang bor bsrang ste /🔽skyil mo krung ngam /
analyzed: mig gnyis ha cang yang mi dbye bar sna'i rtse mor bltas la lus drang bor bsrang ste / skyil mo krung ngam /
translated: Without opening one's eyes too wide, one should look at the tip of one's nose.🔽One should straighten one's body and sit down on a comfortable seat, either in the full cross-legged posture

original: skyil mo krung phyed dam gang yang rung ba byas la nang du bsdus pas bskyed pa'i dran pas stan bde ba la 'dug nas so //
analyzed: skyil mo krung phyed dam gang yang rung ba byas la nang du bsdus pas bskyed pa'i dran pas stan bde ba la 'dug nas so //
translated: or in the half cross-legged posture.

original: yang na ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod lam du gnas nas de kho na la bsgom mo //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod lam du gnas nas de kho na la bsgom mo //
translated: Or else, one should meditate on thatness while maintaining the conduct that one desires.

original: der yang ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan ma snang ba la sems gzhag nas bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: der yang ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan ma snang ba la sems gzhag nas bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa zhi bar byas te /
translated: There, too, having settled the mind on the appearance of the sign as it has been taught, one should pacify laxity, excitement, and so on.

original: zhi gnas sgrub pa la yang dag pa'i so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yid la mi byed pa des mtshan ma de dag yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas sgrub pa la yang dag pa'i so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yid la mi byed pa des mtshan ma de dag yongs su spong ngo //
translated: And by that non-attention which has the nature of correct discernment, one should abandon those signs in the practice of serenity.

original: der yang ji skad thos pa dang bsam pa'i don la nges pa'i tshul gyis so sor brtag par byas te /
analyzed: der yang ji skad thos pa dang bsam pa'i don la nges pa'i tshul gyis so sor brtag par byas te /
translated: There, too, one should investigate the meaning of what one has heard and contemplated by way of ascertainment.

original: rten cing 'brel @132b bar 'byung ba bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel @132b bar 'byung ba bsgom pa'am /
translated: One should investigate dependent origination.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med par so sor brtag pa 'am bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las mi 'byung bar dpyad pa 'am /
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med par so sor brtag pa 'am bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las mi 'byung bar dpyad pa 'am /
translated: One should investigate the absence of coming and going. One should investigate the absence of arising from self, from another, or from both.

original: cha la so sor brtag pa'am /
analyzed: cha la so sor brtag pa'am /
translated: One should investigate the parts.

original: mdor na ji ltar rtog pas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: mdor na ji ltar rtog pas kyang rung ste /
translated: In brief, one should investigate in whatever way one has understood.

original: dngos po med pa la mos pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar so sor brtag par bya'o ;
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mos pa skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar so sor brtag par bya'o ;
translated: One should thus investigate in order to generate the conviction that entities do not exist.

original: / de nas de spong ba na brgya la rnal 'byor ba dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: / de nas de spong ba na brgya la rnal 'byor ba dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then, when that is abandoned, the yogīs might think this:

original: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po 'di dag / don dam par ma skyes su zin kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni skyes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po 'di dag / don dam par ma skyes su zin kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni skyes pa kho na yin no //
translated: “Although these appropriated aggregates such as form, etc. are ultimately unarisen, the perfections such as generosity, etc. are definitely arisen.

original: gzhan du na ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ser sna la sogs pa'i gnyen po dang / longs spyod chen po la sogs pa 'thob pa dang / byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan to snyam nas /
