analyzed: gzhan du na ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ser sna la sogs pa'i gnyen po dang / longs spyod chen po la sogs pa 'thob pa dang / byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bstan to snyam nas /
translated: Otherwise, the Exalted One would not have taught the antidotes to the stinginess, etc. of the Bodhisattvas, the attainment of great wealth, etc., and the accumulation of enlightenment.”

original: de nas rnam par rtog pa de kun du 'byung bar gyur na rnam par mi rtog pa'i thams cad du song ba la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nas rnam par rtog pa de kun du 'byung bar gyur na rnam par mi rtog pa'i thams cad du song ba la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Then, when that conception arises, one does not enter into the non-conceptual state of all-pervasiveness.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa 'di yang de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas yid la mi byed pas spang bar bya'o zhes ston te /🔽de rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma de dag rim gyis spong ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag ni gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa 'di yang de bzhin du rnal 'byor pas yid la mi byed pas spang bar bya'o zhes ston te / de rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma de dag rim gyis spong ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag ni gnyen po ste /
translated: Therefore, this conceptualization should be abandoned in the same way by the yogīs not attending to it.🔽When he gradually abandons those signs of conceptualization in the nature of things, etc.

original: ser sna la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: These perfections are antidotes because they are antidotes to the obscurations of avarice, etc. and the afflictions, etc.

original: ji ltar 'os par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'os par sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be applied as appropriate.

original: rnal 'byor du gnas pa na chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pas de dag la dngos po nyid du mngon par zhen par mi bya zhing rnam par rtog pa de spang bar gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rnal 'byor du gnas pa na chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pas de dag la dngos po nyid du mngon par zhen par mi bya zhing rnam par rtog pa de spang bar gsungs kyi /
translated: When abiding in yoga, because all things are unproduced, the yogī should not adhere to them as entities and should abandon that conceptualization.

original: de dag la brten pa yang dgag par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la brten pa yang dgag par ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that he should abandon the basis of that.

original: de bas na mdo las sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsten par bya ba nyid do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na mdo las sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsten par bya ba nyid do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is the antidote to all obscurations such as generosity and so on, and because it is the accumulation of enlightenment, it is to be cultivated by bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan du na bsam gtan dang shes rab kyang mi bsten na sgrib pa rnams ni ci yang /
analyzed: gzhan du na bsam gtan dang shes rab kyang mi bsten na sgrib pa rnams ni ci yang /
translated: Otherwise, if concentration and wisdom are not cultivated, how could they be obscurations?

original: rnal 'byor par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnal 'byor par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: And how could one be a yogi?

original: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la bsten pa bkag na ni mdo sde mang po dang 'gal te /
analyzed: sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la bsten pa bkag na ni mdo sde mang po dang 'gal te /
translated: If the cultivation of all the levels and perfections is refuted, it contradicts many sutras.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no cause, one will not attain omniscience.

original: @133a * // sa rnams dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid la goms par ma byas na byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas su yang ji ltar rnam par gzhag par 'gyur /
analyzed: @133a * // sa rnams dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen ba nyid la goms par ma byas na byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas su yang ji ltar rnam par gzhag par 'gyur /
translated: If one does not cultivate the levels and omniscience in all aspects, how could one be posited as a bodhisattva or a buddha?

original: de lta bas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to enter the non-conceptual realm,

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pas rnam par rtog pa de spang bar 'di gsungs par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pas rnam par rtog pa de spang bar 'di gsungs par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that the yogin, at the time of abiding in meditative concentration, has taught the abandonment of that conceptualization.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa ni mtshan ma'o zhes thams cad du gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa ni mtshan ma'o zhes thams cad du gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, conceptualization is said to be a sign everywhere,

original: de nyid spang bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid spang bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught to be abandoned.

original: ngo bo nyid la dpyod pa 'am //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la dpyod pa 'am //
translated: Examination of the nature

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod ba nyid do zhes rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod ba nyid do zhes rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: means that the intrinsic identity of generosity, etc. is thought to exist,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma kun du 'byung ba gang dag ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma kun du 'byung ba gang dag ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: and that is connected with the arising of all signs of conceptualization.

original: de la gzhan dag la mchod pa dang phan gdags par 'dod pas gzhan dag la nor dang mi 'jigs pa dang chos rnams kyis nye bar sgrub pa ni sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la gzhan dag la mchod pa dang phan gdags par 'dod pas gzhan dag la nor dang mi 'jigs pa dang chos rnams kyis nye bar sgrub pa ni sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Therein, the intrinsic identity of generosity is threefold: the establishment of others with wealth, protection, and the teaching, by one who desires to worship and benefit others.

original: nyes par spyod pa thams cad las ldog pa dang / dge ba thams cad la 'jug pa ni tshul khrims thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa thams cad las ldog pa dang / dge ba thams cad la 'jug pa ni tshul khrims thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The essence of all morality is the turning away from all evil and the engaging in all that is good.

original: mi mjed pa dang / ji mi snyam pa dang / shes pa dang gsum ni bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mi mjed pa dang / ji mi snyam pa dang / shes pa dang gsum ni bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The essence of all patience is the triad of non-anger, non-contention, and knowledge.

original: dge ba rnams la yang dag par spro ba ni brtson 'grus thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba rnams la yang dag par spro ba ni brtson 'grus thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The essence of all effort is the true enthusiasm for the virtues.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni bsam gtan thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The essence of all meditation is one-pointedness of mind.

original: dngos po rnams la yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa rnam pa gsum ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa rnam pa gsum ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The essence of all wisdom is the triad of the true discernment of things.

original: yon tan la dpyod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i so so'i rgyus long spyod chen po la sogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don du nye bar gnas par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan la dpyod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i so so'i rgyus long spyod chen po la sogs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don du nye bar gnas par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word or in the verse indicates that the analysis of the virtues is also a cause of the great enjoyment, because it is the cause of the great enjoyment in the Bodhisattva's reincarnation.

original: de la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod chen po'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu ni longs spyod chen po'o //
translated: The result of generosity is the great enjoyment.

original: tshul khrims kyi ni lus phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi ni lus phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The result of morality is the perfection of the body.

original: de ni bde 'gro'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bde 'gro'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of good destinies.

original: bzod pa'i ni kun du mdzes pa dang / g-yog 'khor mang po mi zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa'i ni kun du mdzes pa dang / g-yog 'khor mang po mi zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The result of patience is beauty and an inexhaustible retinue.

original: brtson 'grus kyi ni g-yog 'khor mi phyed pa dang / longs spyod rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ni g-yog 'khor mi phyed pa dang / longs spyod rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: The result of effort is an indivisible retinue and uninterrupted resources.

original: bsam gtan gyi ni lus la gnod pa med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi ni lus la gnod pa med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The result of meditation is the absence of physical pain.

original: shes rab kyi ni dbang po thams cad rno ba @133b dang ; bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang bar 'gyur ba dang / skye bo'i tshogs phal po che la dbang byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni dbang po thams cad rno ba @133b dang ; bde ba dang / yid bde ba mang bar 'gyur ba dang / skye bo'i tshogs phal po che la dbang byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The result of wisdom is the sharpness of all the faculties, much happiness and satisfaction, and the sovereignty over a great multitude.

original: bdag dang gzhan thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa ni spyi'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan thams cad rjes su 'dzin pa ni spyi'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The general result is the protection of oneself and all others.

original: snying po la spyod pa 'ang rung zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa de dag mi zad pa dang byang chub thob pa'i rgyur rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po la spyod pa 'ang rung zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa de dag mi zad pa dang byang chub thob pa'i rgyur rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “or else, the enjoyment of the essence” means that they are considered to be the cause of the attainment of enlightenment, because they are dedicated to great enlightenment and are inexhaustible.

original: gnyen po la rtog pa'i mtshan ma yongs su spong ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gnyen po la rtog pa'i mtshan ma yongs su spong ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The avoidance of the signs of conceptualization with regard to the antidote has already been explained.

original: da ni mtshan ma spang ba gsum pa ste /
analyzed: da ni mtshan ma spang ba gsum pa ste /
translated: Now, the third avoidance of signs is stated.

original: des de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: des de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: By that, those, etc.

original: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa spros pa'i dra ba mtha' dag dang bral ba ni de kho na'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa spros pa'i dra ba mtha' dag dang bral ba ni de kho na'o //
translated: The reality is free from the entire net of conceptual elaborations such as existence and nonexistence.

original: rnal 'byor pa 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The yogin thinks as follows:

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med du zin kyang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med du zin kyang /
translated: Even though generosity, etc. are devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: stong pa la sogs pa don dam par bsdus pa dngos por gyur pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod do //
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa don dam par bsdus pa dngos por gyur pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod do //
translated: emptiness, etc. which are included in the ultimate do exist by intrinsic identity.

original: gzhan du na gal te don dam pa nyid kyang med na ni tshangs par spyod pa yang don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te don dam pa nyid kyang med na ni tshangs par spyod pa yang don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: Otherwise, if even the ultimate did not exist, then pure conduct would be pointless.

original: de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpas spang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpas spang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: At that time, this conceptualization is also to be abandoned by the bodhisattva.

original: de dag ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid du zad pas stong pa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dngos por gyur pa ni med do ;
analyzed: de dag ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa tsam gyi mtshan nyid du zad pas stong pa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dngos por gyur pa ni med do ;
translated: Since they are merely the characteristics of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, emptiness and so on do not exist as things that are natures.

original: / gzhan du na stong pa la sogs pa dngos po la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur na /
analyzed: / gzhan du na stong pa la sogs pa dngos po la sogs pa'i ngo bor gyur na /
translated: Otherwise, if emptiness and so on were to become the nature of things and so on,

original: de la dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
translated: how could conceptualizations of things and so on be averted?

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog sprin las /
translated: The noble Cloud of Jewels says,🔽“Son of noble family, if the ultimate did not exist, the pure life would be pointless.”

original: rigs kyi bu gal te don dam pa med du zin na tshangs par spyod pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang de la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo dngos por gyur pa don dam pa yod par ston pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gal te don dam pa med du zin na tshangs par spyod pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang de la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo dngos por gyur pa don dam pa yod par ston pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not teaching that the nature that is the nature of things, the ultimate, exists.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad la sgro btags pa'i gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gal te don dam par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad la sgro btags pa'i gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid gal te don dam par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the characteristics of the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which are superimposed on all illusionlike phenomena, were not the ultimate,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar byis pa'i skye bo yongs su brtags pa bzhin du gang zag dang chos gnyis bden par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar byis pa'i skye bo yongs su brtags pa bzhin du gang zag dang chos gnyis bden par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, how could the person and phenomena become real, just as the childish fully conceive them?

original: de bas na byis pa'i skye bo thams cad ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir de kho na mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na byis pa'i skye bo thams cad ni gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa yin pa'i phyir de kho na mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, all childish beings are attached to the person and phenomena, and thus they do not see reality.

original: de dag bsgrim mi dgos par thar par 'gyur @134a * //
analyzed: de dag bsgrim mi dgos par thar par 'gyur @134a * //
translated: Since they would be liberated without effort,

original: bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid tshangs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid spyad pa rnams don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: bas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid tshangs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid spyad pa rnams don med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: the practice characterized by the cultivation of the noble path would be pointless for the sake of attaining the state of Brahmā, which is characterized by nirvāṇa.🔽This is the meaning of the words.

original: 'di lta ste rang gi mtshan nyid la dpyod pa'am zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dngos por gyur pa ni yod do zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang gi mtshan nyid la dpyod pa'am zhes bya ba la stong pa nyid la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyis dngos por gyur pa ni yod do zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: This is to say, the analysis of intrinsic identity. The conception is that emptiness and so on exist as things that are established by intrinsic identity.

original: yang na sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la sgro btags pa'i gang zag dang chos kyi bdag nyid dang bral ba nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yang na sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la sgro btags pa'i gang zag dang chos kyi bdag nyid dang bral ba nyid stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Or else, the reality of emptiness is the absence of the self of persons and things that are superimposed on all phenomena, such as illusions, etc.

original: de nyid gzhan ma yin pa'i don yin pas de bzhin nyid do//
analyzed: de nyid gzhan ma yin pa'i don yin pas de bzhin nyid do//
translated: It is thusness because it is the meaning of non-differentiation.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i don yin pas yang dag pa'i mtha'o //🔽mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i don yin pas yang dag pa'i mtha'o // mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the limit of reality because it is the meaning of non-error.

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is signless because it is free from all signs.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul yin pas na don dam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dam pa'i spyod yul yin pas na don dam pa'o //
translated: It is the ultimate because it is the domain of the highest non-conceptual wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings te ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings te ;
translated: It is the dharma-dhātu because it is the cause of all buddha-qualities.

original: de bas na 'di dag dngos por gyur pa ni yod pa nyid do zhes de ltar stong pa nyid la sogs pa so so'i tshig gi rang gi mtshan nyid la rtog pa de yang mtshan ma la kun du spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag dngos por gyur pa ni yod pa nyid do zhes de ltar stong pa nyid la sogs pa so so'i tshig gi rang gi mtshan nyid la rtog pa de yang mtshan ma la kun du spyod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the investigation of the individual characteristics of the words such as emptiness, etc., thinking that they are real entities, is also the practice of signs.

original: yon tan la spyod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni de dag bsgoms pas sangs rgyas kyi chos la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan la spyod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni de dag bsgoms pas sangs rgyas kyi chos la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase or in the cultivation of the qualities refers to the notion that all the qualities of the Buddha, etc. will arise through the cultivation of those.🔽 The phrase or in the investigation of the essence refers to the notion that it is the perfected nature because it is the perfected nature that is unmistaken, that is unchanging, and that is fully accomplished.

original: snying po la dpyod pa yang rung zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba'i chos can gyi phyir mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir de thams cad du tshad mas sun ma phyung ba'i phyir tshad mas yang dag par
analyzed: snying po la dpyod pa yang rung zhes bya ba ni mi slu ba'i chos can gyi phyir mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir de thams cad du tshad mas sun ma phyung ba'i phyir tshad mas yang dag par
translated: It is fully accomplished because it is not refuted by any valid cognition, and it is fully accomplished because it is established by valid cognition.

original: grub pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku yang des rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes rtog pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku yang des rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro zhes rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the dharma body of all the Buddhas because it is revealed by that.

original: yid la mi byed pas yongs su spong ngo zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pas yongs su spong ngo zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is abandoned through the absence of mental attention refers to the notion that it is the nature of existence, nonexistence, etc.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir dngos po'i ngo bor yod pa yang ma yin la sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad la gang zag dang chos su sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid dang bral bas
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid tsam du zad pa'i phyir dngos po'i ngo bor yod pa yang ma yin la sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad la gang zag dang chos su sgro btags pa'i bdag nyid dang bral bas
translated: But since they are free from the self that is the superimposition of persons and phenomena on all illusory phenomena,

original: na chos nyid du gdags pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: na chos nyid du gdags pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: they are not nonexistent like the horn of a rabbit, because they are designated as the ultimate nature.

original: de ltar rtogs pa na /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa na /
translated: When one realizes this,

original: de la ngo bo nyid la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: one should abandon the conceptual thoughts of essence and so forth.

original: @134b gnyen po la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma spang ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: @134b gnyen po la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma spang ba bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of abandoning the signs of conceptual thoughts that focus on the antidotes has been completed.

original: da ni mtshan ma yongs su spang ba bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: da ni mtshan ma yongs su spang ba bzhi pa ste /
translated: Now, the fourth, completely abandoning signs,

original: des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: is explained in the lines beginning with “By that…”

original: rnal 'byor pa dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The yogis think as follows.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang de dag la dmigs par gyur pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa don dam pa ngo bo nyid med du zin kyang /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dang de dag la dmigs par gyur pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa don dam pa ngo bo nyid med du zin kyang /
translated: Although generosity and so on and their objects, such as emptiness, are ultimately natureless,

original: de dag bsgoms pa las thob pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i dngos por gyur pa dag ni 'bras bur gyur pas na yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag bsgoms pa las thob pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i dngos por gyur pa dag ni 'bras bur gyur pas na yod pa nyid do //
translated: since they are results obtained from cultivating them, they do exist as things that are natures and so on.

original: gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa la sogs pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sa la sogs pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, “Otherwise, how could bodhisattvas engage in the levels and so on?”

original: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pas rnam par rtog pa 'di yang spang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pas rnam par rtog pa 'di yang spang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: then at that time, yogis and yoginis should abandon this conception.

original: sa la sogs pa dag kyang don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dag kyang don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the levels and so on are ultimately unarisen.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'thob pa ni sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa 'thob pa ni sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The attainment of forbearance with respect to the nonarising of phenomena, the attainment of prophecy, and the attainment of a pure buddhafield are for bodhisattvas who are on the eighth level.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / dbang bskur ba 'thob pa ni de'i gong ma'i sa gnyis la gnas pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / dbang bskur ba 'thob pa ni de'i gong ma'i sa gnyis la gnas pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: The maturation of sentient beings and the attainment of consecration are on the two higher stages, respectively.

original: sa 'di rnams ni lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir sa de ma yin pa gzhan dag pas mchog tu gyur pas na bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma gzhan dag gsungs so //
analyzed: sa 'di rnams ni lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir sa de ma yin pa gzhan dag pas mchog tu gyur pas na bye brag tu rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma gzhan dag gsungs so //
translated: These stages are superior to the other stages because they possess the special qualities of spontaneous accomplishment, etc.

original: sa la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma 'byung ba 'di dag ni las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma 'byung ba 'di dag ni las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa kho na ste /
translated: These signs of conceptualization that occur on the stages are for the beginner yogis,

original: sa la bzhugs pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa la bzhugs pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: but not for those who are established on the stages,

original: de la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are impossible for the latter.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽rang gi mtshan nyid la dpyod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / rang gi mtshan nyid la dpyod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example,🔽the investigation of the characteristics of earth, etc.

original: sa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos por gyur pa ni yod pa nyid do zhes rtog pa 'am /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos por gyur pa ni yod pa nyid do zhes rtog pa 'am /
translated: is the conception that the entities of the characteristics of earth, etc. exist.

original: 'di dag so so rang gi mtshan nyid la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag so so rang gi mtshan nyid la rtog pa'o //
translated: These are the investigations of the own-characteristics of these.

original: de la sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skyon med pa la zhugs pas gang zag dang chos la rmongs pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la sa dang po'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skyon med pa la zhugs pas gang zag dang chos la rmongs pa'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The bodhisattva on the first stage, having entered into the faultless, has as his antidote the confusion about the person and the dharma.

original: gnyis pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pas ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //🔽gsum pa ni 'jig rten gyi snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'i dbang @135a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pas ltung ba phra mo'i 'khrul pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro // gsum pa ni 'jig rten gyi snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'i dbang @135a * //
translated: On the second stage, he has as his antidote the confusion about the error of the subtle transgression, by means of the purity of morality.

original: thob pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: thob pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: On the third stage, he has as his antidote the confusion about the passion of the realm of desire, by means of the attainment of mastery in the worldly meditative concentrations.

original: bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs ji ltar thob pa rnams la mang du gnas pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i chos la sred pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs ji ltar thob pa rnams la mang du gnas pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i chos la sred pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: On the fourth stage, he has as his antidote the confusion about the craving for the meditative concentrations, by means of the frequent practice of the elements of enlightenment as they have been attained.

original: lnga pa ni thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs la gnas pas bden pa rnams bsgoms te /
analyzed: lnga pa ni thabs kyis zin pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs la gnas pas bden pa rnams bsgoms te /
translated: On the fifth stage, he has as his antidote the confusion about the truth, by means of the cultivation of the truths with the help of the elements of enlightenment which are embraced by the means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba la shin tu rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs par yid la byed pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba la shin tu rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang / mngon du phyogs par yid la byed pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The bodhisattva's attention to the complete turning away from and the complete orientation toward cyclic life and nirvana is the antidote to confusion.

original: drug pa ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa mtshan ma med par mang du kun du spyod pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen po dang / 'khor bar 'jug pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: drug pa ni mtshan ma med par gnas pa mtshan ma med par mang du kun du spyod pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen po dang / 'khor bar 'jug pa la rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The sixth is the antidote to confusion about the practice of signlessness and the antidote to confusion about entering cyclic life.

original: bdun pa ni skabs med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa thob pas mtshan ma phra mo rnams la kun du spyod pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: bdun pa ni skabs med par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa thob pas mtshan ma phra mo rnams la kun du spyod pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The seventh is the antidote to confusion about the practice of subtle signs through attaining the state of signlessness without interval.

original: brgyad pa ni lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa thob pas mtshan ma med pa la 'bad cing kun du spyod pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni lhun gyis grub par mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa thob pas mtshan ma med pa la 'bad cing kun du spyod pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The eighth is the antidote to confusion about the practice of signlessness through striving for signlessness through attaining the state of signlessness spontaneously.

original: dgu pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams thob pas rnam pa thams cad du chos bshad pa la dbang thob pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: dgu pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams thob pas rnam pa thams cad du chos bshad pa la dbang thob pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The ninth is the antidote to the confusion about the teaching of all aspects of the Dharma, since one has attained the correct and discerning awarenesses.

original: bcu pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang 'khor dang sprul pa la sogs pa la dbang thob pas mngon par shes pa chen po la rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: bcu pa ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang 'khor dang sprul pa la sogs pa la dbang thob pas mngon par shes pa chen po la rmongs pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The tenth is the antidote to the confusion about the great superknowledges, since one has attained mastery over the buddhaverse, the circle of disciples, emanations, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni mdor na chos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pas shes bya thams cad la phra ba'i ye shes thogs pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por gzhag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni mdor na chos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa'i mkhyen pa brnyes pas shes bya thams cad la phra ba'i ye shes thogs pa'i rmongs pa'i gnyen por gzhag go //
translated: The buddhaverse is posited as the antidote to the confusion about the subtle knowledge of all objects of knowledge, since one has attained the knowledge that is unobstructed and unattached to all aspects of all things.

original: yon tan la spyod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni ji skad du /
analyzed: yon tan la spyod pa 'am zhes bya ba ni ji skad du /
translated: The practice of good qualities is as follows.

original: sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu 'thob pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang /
analyzed: sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu 'thob pa dang / sangs rgyas mthong ba dang / de dag gi byin gyi rlabs kyang yang dag par shes pa dang /
translated: he sees a hundred buddhas and recognizes their blessing;

original: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed pa dang / zhing brgyar 'gro bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya snang bar byed pa dang / sems can brgya yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bskal ba brgyar gnas par byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams brgya g-yo bar byed pa dang / zhing brgyar 'gro bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya snang bar byed pa dang / sems can brgya yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bskal ba brgyar gnas par byed pa dang /
translated: he causes a hundred world systems to quake; he goes to a hundred buddhafields; he illuminates a hundred world systems; he brings a hundred sentient beings to full maturity; he remains for a hundred eons;

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa brgya la @135b 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya 'byed pa dang / lus brgya kun du ston pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya brgya kun du ston pa'i brtson 'grus rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa brgya la @135b 'jug pa dang / chos kyi sgo brgya 'byed pa dang / lus brgya kun du ston pa dang / lus re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor brgya brgya kun du ston pa'i brtson 'grus rnam pa de lta bu rtsom mo //
translated: he penetrates a hundred eons of the past and a hundred eons of the future; he opens a hundred Dharma doors; he manifests a hundred bodies; and on each of those bodies he manifests a hundred bodhisattvas as his retinue.

original: sa gnyis pa la ni 'di dag thams cad grangs stong du bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa la ni 'di dag thams cad grangs stong du bsgyur ba'o //
translated: On the second ground, all of these are multiplied by one thousand.

original: sa gsum pa la ni grangs 'bum mo //
analyzed: sa gsum pa la ni grangs 'bum mo //
translated: On the third ground, they are multiplied by one hundred thousand.

original: sa bzhi pa la ni grangs bye ba phrag brgya'o //
analyzed: sa bzhi pa la ni grangs bye ba phrag brgya'o //
translated: On the fourth ground, they are multiplied by one billion.

original: sa lnga pa la ni grangs bye ba phrag stong ngo //
analyzed: sa lnga pa la ni grangs bye ba phrag stong ngo //
translated: On the fifth ground, they are multiplied by ten billion.

original: sa drug pa la ni grangs bye ba phrag 'bum mo //
analyzed: sa drug pa la ni grangs bye ba phrag 'bum mo //
translated: On the sixth ground, they are multiplied by one trillion.

original: sa bdun pa la ni grangs bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum mo //
analyzed: sa bdun pa la ni grangs bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum mo //
translated: On the seventh ground, they are multiplied by one hundred trillion.

original: sa brgyad pa la ni grangs stong gsum 'bum phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed do ;🔽/ sa dgu pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa 'bum phrag phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed do //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni grangs stong gsum 'bum phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed do ; / sa dgu pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa 'bum phrag phrag bcu tshang ba'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed do //
translated: On the eighth ground, they are equal to the number of atoms in one billion three-thousandfold world systems.🔽On the ninth ground, they are equal to the number of atoms in one hundred thousand “countless” buddha-realms.

original: sa bcu pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed do //
analyzed: sa bcu pa la ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag bcu'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed do //
translated: On the tenth ground, they are equal to the number of atoms in one hundred thousand “countless” buddha-realms to the power of ten.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa ma lus pa nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul thams cad 'dis yongs su mkhyen /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa ma lus pa nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul thams cad 'dis yongs su mkhyen /
translated: At the stage of Buddhahood, he knows all the atoms in all the world-realms, which are as numerous as the infi nitely small particles of which space is composed.

original: phyogs dang dus thams cad du gtogs pa'i dngos po ma lus pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen to zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang dus thams cad du gtogs pa'i dngos po ma lus pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen to zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He knows all the aspects of all things in all times and directions.

original: sangs rgyas kyis la sogs pa'i yon tan ni dpag tu med de mdo sde las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis la sogs pa'i yon tan ni dpag tu med de mdo sde las shes par bya'o //
translated: The qualities of the Buddha stage are immeasurable, as can be learned from the sutras.

original: snying po la dpyod pa yang rung zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying po la dpyod pa yang rung zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The analysis of the essence is appropriate because it is the highest of all mundane and supramundane dharmas, and because it is the cause of the perfection of one’s own and others’ goals.

original: yid la mi byed pas yongs su spang ngo zhes bya ba ni de la dngos por mngon par zhen pa rnams spong ste /
analyzed: yid la mi byed pas yongs su spang ngo zhes bya ba ni de la dngos por mngon par zhen pa rnams spong ste /
translated: It is to be avoided by not attending to it, because those who are attached to things should avoid it.

original: chos thams cad don dam par ma skyes par ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par ma skyes par ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena are of one taste in being ultimately non-arisen.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
translated: The Tathagata is always a non-arisen phenomenon.

original: chos rnams kun kyang bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
analyzed: chos rnams kun kyang bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
translated: All phenomena are like the Sugata.

original: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa yis //🔽'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa yis // 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
translated: Those with childish minds, who apprehend signs,

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: Engage in phenomena that do not exist in the world.

original: de ltar mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pas yongs su spongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pas yongs su spongs shig pa'o //
translated: Thus, by not attending to any signs at all, one should completely abandon them.

original: shin tu brtson pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la 'jug pa'i lam la mngon du yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu brtson pa yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la 'jug pa'i lam la mngon du yang dag par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is very diligent because one has entered the path of engaging in the non-conceptual expanse.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor @136a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor @136a * //
translated: Thus, the yogi,

original: pa mos pa'i dbang dang / shes rab kyis yod pa la sogs par rtog pa mtshan ma'i dra ba thams cad spangs la rtog pa med cing dpyod pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: pa mos pa'i dbang dang / shes rab kyis yod pa la sogs par rtog pa mtshan ma'i dra ba thams cad spangs la rtog pa med cing dpyod pa dang bral ba /
translated: through the power of interest and wisdom, should abandon all the nets of signs, the conceptions of existence and so forth, and be free from conceptualization and analysis.

original: brjod pa med pa /
analyzed: brjod pa med pa /
translated: It is inexpressible.

original: ro gcig pa'i yid kyis de kho na nyid de nyid la mos pas mngon par 'du mi byed par shin tu gsal bar bsgom zhing 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: ro gcig pa'i yid kyis de kho na nyid de nyid la mos pas mngon par 'du mi byed par shin tu gsal bar bsgom zhing 'dug par bya'o //
translated: With a one-pointed mind, one should meditate on reality with conviction, without fabrication, and remain in that state.

original: de la gnas pa'i sems kyi rgyud mi g-yeng bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i sems kyi rgyud mi g-yeng bar bya'o //
translated: One should not allow the mind to be distracted from that state.

original: gang gi tshe bar skabs su rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bar skabs su rnam par g-yeng bar gyur na de'i tshe /
translated: If the mind becomes distracted in the meantime,

original: de zhi bar byas nas yang de nyid la sems yongs su gtad do //
analyzed: de zhi bar byas nas yang de nyid la sems yongs su gtad do //
translated: then, having pacified that, one should again focus the mind on that object.

original: gang gi tshe de la sems mi dga' bar gyur bar mthong ba de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mthong bas de la dga' ba sgoms shig dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pa mthong bas mi dga' ba zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de la sems mi dga' bar gyur bar mthong ba de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mthong bas de la dga' ba sgoms shig dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pa mthong bas mi dga' ba zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one sees that the mind is not pleased with that object, then, by seeing the virtues of samādhi, one should cultivate delight in that, and the displeasure will be pacified by seeing the faults of distraction.

original: ci ste rmugs pa la sogs pa'i zil gyis non pas rgyu ba mi gsal te /
analyzed: ci ste rmugs pa la sogs pa'i zil gyis non pas rgyu ba mi gsal te /
translated: If one is overcome by dullness, etc., and the movement of the mind is unclear,

original: bying bas sems mi dga' bar gyur bar mthong ba de'i tshe rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la sogs pa'i yid la bya bas bying ba zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: bying bas sems mi dga' bar gyur bar mthong ba de'i tshe rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la sogs pa'i yid la bya bas bying ba zhi bar byas te /
translated: When he sees that his mind is not delighted because of laxity, then he should eliminate laxity by bringing to mind things that inspire him, such as the joy of liberation.

original: yang de kho na nyid la rab tu gsal bar gzung ngo //🔽ci ste gang gi tshe sngon myong ba'i yul sdug pa la sogs pa dran pas bar skabs su sems rgod pa 'am /
analyzed: yang de kho na nyid la rab tu gsal bar gzung ngo // ci ste gang gi tshe sngon myong ba'i yul sdug pa la sogs pa dran pas bar skabs su sems rgod pa 'am /
translated: Then he should again hold the object of meditation very clearly in mind.

original: rgod du dogs pa mthong ba de'i tshe mi rtag pa la sogs pa skyo bar 'gyur ba 'di dngos po yid la byas nas rgod pa zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgod du dogs pa mthong ba de'i tshe mi rtag pa la sogs pa skyo bar 'gyur ba 'di dngos po yid la byas nas rgod pa zhi bar bya'o //
translated: But when he sees that his mind is agitated or in danger of agitation because he is recollecting attractive objects that he has previously experienced, then he should eliminate agitation by bringing to mind things that inspire disenchantment, such as impermanence.

original: de nas yang de kho na nyid de nyid la mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug par 'bad par bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe bying ba dang rgod pa las dben te /
analyzed: de nas yang de kho na nyid de nyid la mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug par 'bad par bya'o // gang gi tshe bying ba dang rgod pa las dben te /
translated: Then he should again strive to engage the object of meditation without any mental construction.

original: sems mnyam par 'jug par mthong ba de'i tshe rtsol klod de btang snyoms su bya'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par 'jug par mthong ba de'i tshe rtsol klod de btang snyoms su bya'o //
translated: When he sees that his mind is staying evenly with the object of meditation, free from laxity and agitation, then he should neither apply nor relax effort, but remain as he is.

original: gal te sems mnyam par gnas par gyur ba la brtsal ba byas na de'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sems mnyam par gnas par gyur ba la brtsal ba byas na de'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one strives for the mind to rest evenly, then the mind becomes distracted.

original: gal te sems zhum par gyur pa la brtsal ba ma byas na de'i bying ba zhi bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sems zhum par gyur pa la brtsal ba ma byas na de'i bying ba zhi bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not strive for the mind that is depressed, then its sinking does not subside.

original: des na skyes bu da mus long bzhin du de kho na gsal bar zin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na skyes bu da mus long bzhin du de kho na gsal bar zin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, like a blind person without a guide, one does not apprehend reality clearly.

original: de bas na bying ba'i sems ni gsal bar bya zhing dgod pa zhi bar byas te mnyam pa thob nas btang snyoms su bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bying ba'i sems ni gsal bar bya zhing dgod pa zhi bar byas te mnyam pa thob nas btang snyoms su bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should clarify and uplift the depressed mind, and having attained its balance, one should be equanimous.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pas ji srid 'dod kyi bar du mngon par 'du bya ba med par de kho na nyid bsgom zhing mos pa'i dbang gis 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pas ji srid 'dod kyi bar du mngon par 'du bya ba med par de kho na nyid bsgom zhing mos pa'i dbang gis 'dug par bya'o //
translated: Then, the yogī should meditate on reality without mental construction for as long as he wishes, and should remain by the power of his aspiration.

original: de nas @136b ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'dod na 'di snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: de nas @136b ting nge 'dzin las ldang bar 'dod na 'di snyam du bsams te /
translated: Then, if he wishes to rise from samadhi, he should think this:

original: chos 'di dag thams cad don dam par ma byung du zin kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa la ltos nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad don dam par ma byung du zin kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur rgyu dang rkyen so sor nges pa la ltos nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: Although all these phenomena are ultimately non-arisen, they do arise in dependence upon the individual ascertainment of causes and conditions, like an illusion and so forth.

original: de bas na bdag gis sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang 'thob par 'dod pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shin tu rgyas pa dpag tu med pa la brtson par bya'o snyam du bsam mo //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi go 'phang 'thob par 'dod pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs shin tu rgyas pa dpag tu med pa la brtson par bya'o snyam du bsam mo //
translated: Therefore, I will strive in the vast and immeasurable accumulation of merit and wisdom in order to attain the state of buddhahood for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag byas te /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag byas te /
translated: Then, having paid homage to the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: de dag la mchod nas 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa la sogs pa smon lam chen po btab ste ldang ngo //
analyzed: de dag la mchod nas 'phags pa bzang po spyod pa la sogs pa smon lam chen po btab ste ldang ngo //
translated: having made offerings to them, one should recite the noble Samantabhadra's great prayers of aspiration and so forth, and rise.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur phyin ci ma log pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i stong pa nyid dang snying rje dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sgrub pa
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur phyin ci ma log pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i stong pa nyid dang snying rje dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sgrub pa
translated: One should practice the accumulations of merit and wisdom, such as generosity, which are endowed with emptiness and compassion, and which are dedicated without error to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, as if they were like an illusion.

original: mtha' dag la sgyu ma mkhan lta bur brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag la sgyu ma mkhan lta bur brtson par bya'o //
translated: One should practice all of that with the effort of a magician.

original: de ltar byas na rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong ba nyid kyi bsam gtan sgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong ba nyid kyi bsam gtan sgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: If one does it that way, one will accomplish the meditative stabilization of emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che las /
analyzed: 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che las /
translated: As it says in the noble Sūtra of Ratnachuda:

original: de byams pa chen po'i go bgos nas snying rje chen po'i gnas la rab tu gnas te /
analyzed: de byams pa chen po'i go bgos nas snying rje chen po'i gnas la rab tu gnas te /
translated: “Having put on the armor of great love, and having been established in the abode of great compassion,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed do //
translated: one should meditate on the meditative stabilization that accomplishes emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid de gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid de gang zhe na /
translated: What is emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects?

original: gang sbyin pa dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: gang sbyin pa dang ma bral ba /
translated: He is never separated from generosity,

original: tshul khrims dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ma bral ba /
translated: never separated from morality,

original: bzod pa dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ma bral ba /
translated: never separated from patience,

original: brtson 'grus dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ma bral ba /
translated: never separated from effort,

original: bsam gtan dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ma bral ba /
translated: never separated from meditation,

original: shes rab dang ma bral ba /
analyzed: shes rab dang ma bral ba /
translated: never separated from wisdom,

original: thabs dang ma bral ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thabs dang ma bral ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: never separated from means, and so on, as it is taught.

original: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa la sogs pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa la sogs pa las kyang /
translated: And in the Noble Teaching of Vimalakīrti and so on,

original: thabs dang bral ba'i shes rab 'ba' zhig ston pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'ching ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thabs dang bral ba'i shes rab 'ba' zhig ston pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'ching ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that “the wisdom that is devoid of means is the fetter of the bodhisattva.”

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' dus thams cad du snying rje chen po sngon du byas la sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sgrub pa la nges par brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' dus thams cad du snying rje chen po sngon du byas la sbyin pa la sogs pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sgrub pa la nges par brtson par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should always make great compassion his forerunner and should definitely strive to accomplish the accumulations of merit and wisdom, such as generosity.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pa ji srid du sa la ma zhugs pa de @137a * //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pa ji srid du sa la ma zhugs pa de @137a * //
translated: Then, the yogī, for as long as he has not entered the stages,

original: srid du ji skad bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du mos pa'i dbang gis mos pas spyod pa'i sa na da kho na nyid la bsgom pa na yang dag par sbyor ba dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: srid du ji skad bshad pa'i cho ga bzhin du mos pa'i dbang gis mos pas spyod pa'i sa na da kho na nyid la bsgom pa na yang dag par sbyor ba dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: When one cultivates reality, it is called right application and right meditative concentration.

original: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la shin tu brtson pa yin te ;
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la shin tu brtson pa yin te ;
translated: One is diligent in the nonconceptual realm.

original: re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la ni ma reg mod kyi /
analyzed: re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la ni ma reg mod kyi /
translated: One has not yet touched the nonconceptual realm.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la reg par 'gyur ba'i tshul bzhin gyi ting nge 'dzin ni yod do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la reg pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la reg par 'gyur ba'i tshul bzhin gyi ting nge 'dzin ni yod do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la reg pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: However, one has right meditative concentration that is conducive to touching the nonconceptual realm. This shows that it is conducive to touching the nonconceptual realm.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i sbyor ba bstan nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i sbyor ba bstan nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa ste /
translated: Thus, having explained right application, it shows the entry into the nonconceptual realm.

original: bsdus pa'i don brgyad pa ston te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don brgyad pa ston te /
translated: It shows the eighth summarized meaning.

original: de yang dag par sbyor ba de dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dag par sbyor ba de dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is the right application.

original: de ltar yang dag par sbyor ba'i thos pa dang / sems pa dang bsgom pa'i rim pa ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rtag tu gus par byas te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag par sbyor ba'i thos pa dang / sems pa dang bsgom pa'i rim pa ji skad du bstan pa bzhin du rtag tu gus par byas te /
translated: Thus, having applied oneself correctly, one should always respectfully cultivate the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation just as they have been taught.🔽Having cultivated them for a long time, after countless eons have passed, one will perfect the meditation on the meaning of reality, just like the fire produced by rubbing the sticks together.

original: yun ring por bsgoms nas bskal pa grangs med pa 'das par gyur pa dang / gtsub shing gis gtsubs pa'i me bzhin du yang dag pa'i don la bsgom pa mthar phyin par 'gyur zhing rtog pa'i dran pa mtha' dag dang bral ba spros pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs te /
analyzed: yun ring por bsgoms nas bskal pa grangs med pa 'das par gyur pa dang / gtsub shing gis gtsubs pa'i me bzhin du yang dag pa'i don la bsgom pa mthar phyin par 'gyur zhing rtog pa'i dran pa mtha' dag dang bral ba spros pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings rtogs te /
translated: One will realize the unelaborated dharmadhātu, free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: shin tu gsal ba /🔽dri ma med pa /
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba / dri ma med pa /
translated: It is extremely clear,🔽stainless,

original: mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba /
translated: unmoving,

original: rlung med par gzhag pa'i mar me 'bar ba'i rgyun bzhin du mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: rlung med par gzhag pa'i mar me 'bar ba'i rgyun bzhin du mi g-yo ba /
translated: and unwavering like a butter lamp placed in a windless place.

original: tshad mar gyur pa chos thams cad bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa mthong ba'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa 'jig rten las
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa chos thams cad bdag med pa'i de kho na nyid mngon sum du byed pa mthong ba'i lam gyis yang dag par bsdus pa don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa 'jig rten las
translated: The supreme valid cognition, the path of seeing, which directly realizes the reality of the selflessness of all phenomena, is the essence of ultimate bodhicitta.

original: 'das pa'i ye shes mchog 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i ye shes mchog 'byung ste /
translated: From that, the supreme supramundane wisdom arises, which is effortless.

original: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnal 'byor pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du zhugs pa yin /
translated: At that time, the yogi has entered nonconceptuality.

original: sa dang po thob pa yang yin te spyir bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa yang yin te spyir bstan pa'i don to //
translated: He has also attained the first bhumi. This is the general meaning.

original: bsten pas rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu'i dngos por bstan pa ste lung la brten cing kun du bsten pa la bya'o ;
analyzed: bsten pas rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu'i dngos por bstan pa ste lung la brten cing kun du bsten pa la bya'o ;
translated: “ It follows the reliance” indicates the cause of the wisdom of hearing. It is the reliance on and the following of the scriptures.

original: / bsgoms pas rjes su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'i shes rab ste bsgoms pas 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / bsgoms pas rjes su 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni bsams pa'i shes rab ste bsgoms pas 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “ It follows meditation” indicates the wisdom of reflection. It is called “following meditation.”

original: mang du byas pas rjes su 'gro 'o zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: mang du byas pas rjes su 'gro 'o zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: “ It follows much practice” indicates the wisdom of meditation.

original: rnam par mi g-yeng bar rgyun du bsgom pa mang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng bar rgyun du bsgom pa mang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one cultivates them frequently without distraction.

original: yang dag par yid la bya bas rjes @137b su 'gro ba na zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'di rnams kyis phyin ci ma log par sbyor bas rjes su 'gro bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par yid la bya bas rjes @137b su 'gro ba na zhes bya ba ni shes rab 'di rnams kyis phyin ci ma log par sbyor bas rjes su 'gro bar bstan pa'o //
translated: When one follows them through correct mental attention, this shows that one follows them through the application of these knowledges without error.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med cing zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med cing zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis grub pa'i khyad par te /
translated: Without overt operations refers to the distinctive spontaneity.

original: rgyun ma chad par gus par byas nas ring por bsgoms te bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pas las su rung ba'i ting nge 'dzin dam pa'i stobs kyis zhum pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral zhing zhi gnas
analyzed: rgyun ma chad par gus par byas nas ring por bsgoms te bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa bsags pas las su rung ba'i ting nge 'dzin dam pa'i stobs kyis zhum pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral zhing zhi gnas
translated: Because one cultivates them for a long time with devotion and without interruption, one accumulates immeasurable collections of merit and knowledge, and by the power of the excellent concentration that is serviceable, one is free from the faults of depression, agitation, etc.,

original: dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and one enters the union of serenity and insight.

original: gang gi tshe mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i lam yang dag par 'byung ba de'i tshe lhun gyis grub pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la reg ces bya ba'i don te mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa'i lam yang dag par 'byung ba de'i tshe lhun gyis grub pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la reg ces bya ba'i don te mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: When the path of effortless engagement arises, then one touches the nonconceptual realm spontaneously, because it is actualized.

original: sa dang por zhugs nas de'i gong ma'i sa rnams rnam par sbyang ngo //
analyzed: sa dang por zhugs nas de'i gong ma'i sa rnams rnam par sbyang ngo //
translated: Having entered the first stage, one purifies the higher stages.

original: yang na bsten pas rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis bsgom par sbyor ba chung du 'bring dang rab dang rab kyi mchog rnams bstan te /
analyzed: yang na bsten pas rjes su 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis bsgom par sbyor ba chung du 'bring dang rab dang rab kyi mchog rnams bstan te /
translated: Or else, the small, medium, and great preparations for meditation are indicated by the words, “By practice, one follows it,” etc.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi'i gnas dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi'i gnas dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: In the same order as the four stages of ascertainment.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid de bsdus pa'i don dgu pa ston to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings kyi mtshan nyid de bsdus pa'i don dgu pa ston to //
translated: Why? etc. indicates the ninth topic, the characteristic of the nonconceptual realm.

original: dpyad pa'i rnam par brtag pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'di'o //
analyzed: dpyad pa'i rnam par brtag pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'di'o //
translated: It is said to transcend all conceptual analysis.

original: pha ba'i 'o zhes rang gi rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis brtag mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha ba'i 'o zhes rang gi rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis brtag mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot be investigated by any of one’s own conceptualizations, such as “It is like this or not like this.”

original: de bas na gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is formless.

original: bstan pa dang dper rnam par brtag pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la 'di na 'di 'dra'o zhes bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa dang dper rnam par brtag pa thams cad las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la 'di na 'di 'dra'o zhes bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ It is beyond all description and illustration” means that it cannot be described to others as “It is like this.”

original: de bas na bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bstan du med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is indescribable.

original: dbang por rnam par brtag pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa nang gi skye mched kyi mtshan nyid du rnam par brtag pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dbang por rnam par brtag pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi dbang po la sogs pa nang gi skye mched kyi mtshan nyid du rnam par brtag pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: “ It is beyond all conceptualization as a sense object” means that it is beyond all conceptualization as having the nature of the inner sense bases, such as the eye sense faculty, etc.

original: / de bas na de ni nang gi skye mched gang la yang mi brten pa'i phyir rten med pa'o //
analyzed: / de bas na de ni nang gi skye mched gang la yang mi brten pa'i phyir rten med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is without support because it does not rely on any of the inner sense bases.

original: yul du rnam par brtag pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i skye mched kyi mtshan nyid du rnam par brtag pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid las 'das pa'i @138a * //
analyzed: yul du rnam par brtag pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa phyi'i skye mched kyi mtshan nyid du rnam par brtag pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid las 'das pa'i @138a * //
translated: “Totally beyond all conceptual thoughts about objects” means that it is beyond the nature of all conceptual thoughts about the characteristics of the external sense bases such as form, etc.

original: phyir ro ; / de bas na de ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lta bur snang ba ma yin pas snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ro ; / de bas na de ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lta bur snang ba ma yin pas snang ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not an appearance as an object such as form, etc., and so it is non-appearance.

original: rnam par rig par rnam par brtag pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par brtag pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par rnam par brtag pa thams cad las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par brtag pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Totally beyond all conceptual thoughts about awareness” means that it is beyond the nature of all conceptual thoughts about the characteristics of the awarenesses such as the eye, etc.

original: de bas na rnam par rig pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rig pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not an awareness.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not their nature.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnas med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi dbyings la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi rten med pas
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnas med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi dbyings la glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi rten med pas
translated: The natural luminosity of the dharmadhātu is not a basis for any obscurations of the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no basis,

original: de bas na 'di la gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'di la gnas med pa ste /
translated: therefore, there is no basis here.

original: de la sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no basis for any obscurations there.

original: de bas na de'i chos thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i chos thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because all phenomena there are beyond conceptualization, it is called non-conceptual.🔽What is that?

original: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci zhes dri bar sems pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci zhes dri bar sems pa ste /
translated: He thinks, “What is that?”

original: 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: He thinks this:

original: gal te chos thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa las shin tu 'das na de la de'i mtshan nyid ces ji skad du bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa las shin tu 'das na de la de'i mtshan nyid ces ji skad du bya snyam pa la /
translated: If it is beyond all conceptualization of phenomena, how can it be called the characteristic of that?

original: de'i lan du gzugs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i lan du gzugs med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, he says, “The formless, etc.”

original: 'di ni de'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: This is its characteristic.

original: gang chos thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa las shin tu 'das pa'o zhes dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa las shin tu 'das pa'o zhes dgongs pa ste /
translated: The thought is that it is the transcendence of all conceptualization of phenomena.

original: gang gi ngo bo gang yin pa rnam pa de lta bu de nyid la mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo gang yin pa rnam pa de lta bu de nyid la mtshan nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The nature of that which is of such a kind is called its characteristic.

original: de bas na chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid las shin tu 'das pa de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid las shin tu 'das pa de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of that which is the transcendence of the characteristic of all phenomena is that characteristic.

original: de brjod pa ni kun rdzob ces bya'i dngos su ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de brjod pa ni kun rdzob ces bya'i dngos su ni ma yin te /
translated: Its expression is called “conventional,” but not in reality,

original: de kho na ni thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na ni thams cad las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that reality is the transcendence of all.

original: tha snyad kyi spyod yul yin na ni de nyid kun rdzob tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi spyod yul yin na ni de nyid kun rdzob tu 'gyur te /
translated: If it were the domain of conventional usage, it would be conventional,

original: don dam par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and not ultimate.

original: de skad du yang 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las kyang /
translated: Thus, it is said in the Noble Teaching of the Two Truths:🔽“The conventional is the domain of conventional usage.

original: lha'i bu gal te don dam par bden pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi dngos por gyur na ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu gal te don dam par bden pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi yul gyi dngos por gyur na ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su mi 'gro ste /
translated: Devaputra, if in the ultimate truth, the body, speech, and mind were to become objects of things, then it would not be counted as the ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would become the conventional truth.

original: lha'i bu 'di ltar yang don dam par na don @138b dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las shin tu 'das pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu 'di ltar yang don dam par na don @138b dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las shin tu 'das pa ste /
translated: Devaputra, in this way, in the ultimate truth, the ultimate truth is utterly beyond all conventions.

original: khyad par med pa /
analyzed: khyad par med pa /
translated: It is without distinctions.

original: ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa /
translated: It is unborn.

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: It is unceasing.

original: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa dang / shes bya dang / shes pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dang / rjod pa dang / shes bya dang / shes pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the expressed, the expression, the object of cognition, and cognition.

original: lha'i bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul las 'das pa ste /
translated: Devaputra, it is beyond the domain of the wisdom of omniscience.

original: lha'i bu de la rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'jug go //
analyzed: lha'i bu de la rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'jug go //
translated: Devaputra, in that, conceptualization and discursive thought do not operate.

original: don dam pa de la pha rol dang tshu rol dang dbus med do //
analyzed: don dam pa de la pha rol dang tshu rol dang dbus med do //
translated: In that ultimate truth, there is no far shore, near shore, or middle.

original: lha'i bu 'di sgro btags te /
analyzed: lha'i bu 'di sgro btags te /
translated: Devaputra, this is a superimposition.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bsnyad kyi /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bsnyad kyi /
translated: It is called the ultimate truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes ji skad du bya ba ltar ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes ji skad du bya ba ltar ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is not as it is said, “ultimate truth.”

original: da ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: da ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su zhugs pa'i rtags te /
translated: Now, the sign of entering the nonconceptual realm is as follows:

original: bsdus pa'i don bcu pa ni /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don bcu pa ni /
translated: The tenth point of the summary is

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas pas ni shes bya dang khyad par med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas pas ni shes bya dang khyad par med pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “When one abides in the nonconceptual realm, there is no difference between the knower and the known.”

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rnam par zhugs pas shes pa dang shes bya la bye brag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i rnam par zhugs pas shes pa dang shes bya la bye brag mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has entered into the nonapprehension of all phenomena, there is no apprehension of a difference between the knower and the known.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad nam mkha'i dkyil dang mtshungs par mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad nam mkha'i dkyil dang mtshungs par mthong ste /
translated: Therefore, one sees all phenomena as being like the center of space,

original: rnam pa thams cad du ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan ma thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan ma thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the signs that were taught do not appear in any way.

original: 'o na de'i tshe sus mthong /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe sus mthong /
translated: Well then, who sees at that time?

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true.

original: don dam par gang zag la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnal 'byor pa'i rang gi rgyud gang yang med pas mthong ba yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: don dam par gang zag la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnal 'byor pa'i rang gi rgyud gang yang med pas mthong ba yang med mod kyi /
translated: In the ultimate, since there is no entity of a person and so on in the continuum of the yogi himself, there is no seeing.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rnam par 'byung ba tsam gyi shes pa nyid la lha sbyin nam mchod sbyin gyis mthong ngo zhes de lta de ltar 'jig rten na tha snyad 'dogs pa
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi rnam par 'byung ba tsam gyi shes pa nyid la lha sbyin nam mchod sbyin gyis mthong ngo zhes de lta de ltar 'jig rten na tha snyad 'dogs pa
