translated: Nevertheless, just as, although ultimately there is no entity, in the relative, consciousness that is the mere appearance of objects such as form is called “seen by Devadatta” or “seen by Yajñadatta,”

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang ye shes nyid don dam par ngo bo nyid med mod kyi yang dag pa'i don la bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa'i rnam pas bdag nyid kyang rang rig pas ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang ye shes nyid don dam par ngo bo nyid med mod kyi yang dag pa'i don la bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa'i rnam pas bdag nyid kyang rang rig pas ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa
translated: in the same way, here, although gnosis itself is ultimately without entity, by the power of meditating on the meaning of reality, the aspect of realizing that all phenomena are without entity is itself realized by reflexive awareness to be without entity.

original: skye ba'i tshe rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes kyis mthong ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes kyis mthong ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: When it arises, it is taught that the yogi’s gnosis sees.

original: chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med mod kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par ngo bo nyid med mod kyi /
translated: All phenomena are ultimately without entity.

original: kun rdzob tu rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes las so so skye bo'i shes pa gzhan du mi 'dod dam /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes las so so skye bo'i shes pa gzhan du mi 'dod dam /
translated: Don’t you accept that, conventionally, the consciousness of an ordinary being is different from the wisdom of a yogi?

original: gzhan du na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ji @139a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ji @139a * //
translated: Otherwise, how could you posit the different types of persons, such as the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas?

original: ltar 'gyur / de skad du yang 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: ltar 'gyur / de skad du yang 'phags pa bden pa gnyis bstan pa las kyang /
translated: As it says in the Noble Teaching of the Two Truths:

original: de don dam par shin tu med kyang gang kun rdzob tu lam bsgom mo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de don dam par shin tu med kyang gang kun rdzob tu lam bsgom mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Although it does not exist ultimately, it is cultivated conventionally.”

original: gang kun rdzob tu yang rgyu med pa de ni thams cad du yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang kun rdzob tu yang rgyu med pa de ni thams cad du yang mi skye ste /
translated: That which does not exist even conventionally does not arise in any way,

original: kun rdzob tu yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: just like the horns of an ass.

original: gang yod pa de ni don dam par brdzun yang skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni don dam par brdzun yang skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: That which exists arises even though it is false ultimately,

original: sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just like a magical creation or a reflection.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang don dam par mi rigs te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang don dam par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that dependent origination exists ultimately.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa yang don dam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa yang don dam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because illusions and so on would become ultimate realities.

original: ci ste sgyu ma la sogs pa dang bye brag mang bar brtag mi bzod de /
analyzed: ci ste sgyu ma la sogs pa dang bye brag mang bar brtag mi bzod de /
translated: If you say that illusions and so on cannot bear analysis because they are many,

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthas stong la dbus kyang gcig dang du ma'i dngos por gzung du med de /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mthas stong la dbus kyang gcig dang du ma'i dngos por gzung du med de /
translated: then since they are empty of a prior limit and a later limit, the middle also cannot be apprehended as a thing that is one or many.

original: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las 'byung bar mi 'thad la /🔽gzhan la rag lus shing 'byung ba'i phyir bdag gi rgyud bdag med par brjod bzhin du don dam par yod do zhes ming 'dogs na ni ci dga' bar ming thogs la zas kyang byin cig /'on kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa las don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las 'byung bar mi 'thad la / gzhan la rag lus shing 'byung ba'i phyir bdag gi rgyud bdag med par brjod bzhin du don dam par yod do zhes ming 'dogs na ni ci dga' bar ming thogs la zas kyang byin cig /'on kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa las don dam pa'i mtshan nyid de
translated: It is not tenable that they arise from self, from other, or from both.🔽If you designate something as ultimately existent, even though you say that it is selflessness in one’s own continuum, since it arises in dependence on something else, then you can designate it as you like, but you should also give it food.

original: khyad par yod par brjod dgos so //
analyzed: khyad par yod par brjod dgos so //
translated: However, you must state the difference between ultimate reality and illusions and so on.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa yang ma 'khrul bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa yang ma 'khrul bar 'gyur te /
translated: Illusions and so on would also become nonerroneous,

original: de dag kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are dependently arisen.

original: gang gis na glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par da ltar shes pa 'byung bas sgyu ma la sogs pa shes pa'i ngo bor bden par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gis na glang po che la sogs pa'i rnam par da ltar shes pa 'byung bas sgyu ma la sogs pa shes pa'i ngo bor bden par gyur na /
translated: Since the consciousness of an elephant and so on arises in the aspect of an elephant and so on, if the illusion and so on were truly the entity of the consciousness of the illusion and so on,🔽

original: gzhan gyi rnam par gzhan 'byung bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam par gzhan 'byung bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: If the elephant and so on were real in the nature of the consciousness of the illusion, then it would be illogical for something else to arise in the aspect of something else.

original: de nyid dang gzhan gnyis ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan gnyis ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because reality and otherness are mutually exclusive.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni gnyis kyi rnam par 'byung bar mi 'gyur te yang dag pa ma yin pa gnyis gcig na 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni gnyis kyi rnam par 'byung bar mi 'gyur te yang dag pa ma yin pa gnyis gcig na 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nondual consciousness does not arise in the aspect of duality, because it is contradictory for the unreal to be one.

original: ma byung ba las 'byung zhing nas kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma byung ba las 'byung zhing nas kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not arise from what has not occurred and would not disintegrate after having occurred.

original: gcig la yod pa dang med pa gnyis rim gyis na yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gcig la yod pa dang med pa gnyis rim gyis na yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro /
translated: This is because it is contradictory for one thing to exist and not exist.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽It is illogical for an existent

original: rang bzhin la ni yod pa dang // med pa rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rang bzhin la ni yod pa dang // med pa rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: or nonexistent nature to be

original: phan tshun du ni 'gal ba na //
analyzed: phan tshun du ni 'gal ba na //
translated: mutually exclusive.

original: yod med gcig tu ga la rung //
analyzed: yod med gcig tu ga la rung //
translated: How could existence and nonexistence be one?

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod na //
translated: If it existed by its own nature,

original: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: it would not become nonexistent.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: It is never tenable

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bshad do //
translated: that an intrinsic nature changes into something else.

original: de lta bas na ji ltar sman dang sngags la sogs pa'i rkyen @139b tshogs pa'i dbang gis brdzun pa yin yang sgyu ma 'byung ba de ltar las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ma brtags na dga' ba so so'i skye bo rnams kyi skye bo sgyu ma dang
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar sman dang sngags la sogs pa'i rkyen @139b tshogs pa'i dbang gis brdzun pa yin yang sgyu ma 'byung ba de ltar las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ma brtags na dga' ba so so'i skye bo rnams kyi skye bo sgyu ma dang
translated: Thus, just as an illusion arises through the power of the assemblage of conditions such as medicine, spells, and so on, even though it is false, in the same way, the illusion of an ordinary being arises through the power of karma and afflictions, which is delightful if not analyzed, for ordinary beings.

original: / de bzhin du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mthus rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes sgyu ma skye'o //
analyzed: / de bzhin du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mthus rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor pa'i ye shes sgyu ma skye'o //
translated: Likewise, the illusion of the wisdom of yogins arises through the power of the accumulation of merit and wisdom.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ma brtags na dga' ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du ma brtags na dga' ba ste /
translated: Causes and conditions are delightful if not analyzed, like illusions and so on.

original: thog ma med pa'i rgyu brgyud pas 'brel ba'i rang bzhin yin pas thams cad mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i rgyu brgyud pas 'brel ba'i rang bzhin yin pas thams cad mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Since they are related through beginningless causal continuity, there is no contradiction at all.

original: de'i rjes las thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pas ni sems can gyi 'jig rten du bsdus pa rnams sgyu ma dang mtshungs par mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes las thob pas ni sems can gyi 'jig rten du bsdus pa rnams sgyu ma dang mtshungs par mthong ste /
translated: The so-called subsequent stage is the seeing of those included in the world of sentient beings as similar to illusions, by the subsequent stage of supramundane, nonconceptual intuition.

original: sems can gyi gzugs su snang ba ni sgyu ma byas pa'i glang po che la sogs pa lta bu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi gzugs su snang ba ni sgyu ma byas pa'i glang po che la sogs pa lta bu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the appearance of sentient beings as forms is like an illusory elephant, etc.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten bsdus pa rnams ni smig rgyu dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten bsdus pa rnams ni smig rgyu dang mtshungs par te /
translated: Those included in the world of the container are seen as similar to mirages.

original: smig rgyu bzhin du phyi rol gyi dmigs pa phal che bas brdzun pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu bzhin du phyi rol gyi dmigs pa phal che bas brdzun pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like a mirage, they appear as false to most external observers.

original: yul dang longs spyod kyi ngo bo rnams ni rmi lam dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: yul dang longs spyod kyi ngo bo rnams ni rmi lam dang mtshungs par te /
translated: The natures of objects and enjoyments are similar to dreams.

original: rmi lam lta bur brdzun pa de la 'dod pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bur brdzun pa de la 'dod pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like dreams, desire arises in regard to them, although they are false.

original: lus kyi las kyi ngo bo nyid rnams ni mig yor dang mtshungs par te ;
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi ngo bo nyid rnams ni mig yor dang mtshungs par te ;
translated: The natures of bodily actions are similar to reflections.

original: chos thams cad byed pa med kyang mig yor bzhin du lus kyi byed pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad byed pa med kyang mig yor bzhin du lus kyi byed pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, although all dharmas are without activity, the activity of the body appears, like a magical creation.

original: ngag gi las kyi ngo bo nyid ni brag ca dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: ngag gi las kyi ngo bo nyid ni brag ca dang mtshungs par te /
translated: The nature of verbal action is like an echo,

original: brag ca bzhin du brdzun pa yin yang thos pa'i lam du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brag ca bzhin du brdzun pa yin yang thos pa'i lam du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, although it is false, like an echo, it is the means of entry into the path of hearing.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par te /
translated: Those in the desire realm are like a reflection,

original: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur bsdus pa rnams sngon ji ltar byas pa'i las dang mthun par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur bsdus pa rnams sngon ji ltar byas pa'i las dang mthun par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise in accordance with the karma previously performed, included in the result of the evolution of previous karma.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin du bsdus pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur bsdus pa rnams ni chu zla dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin du bsdus pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur bsdus pa rnams ni chu zla dang mtshungs par te /
translated: Those included in the result of the evolution of karma included in the concentrations of the form and formless realms are like the moon in the water,

original: ting nge 'dzin ni chu dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni chu dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because concentration is like water.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la sogs pas bsdus pa rnams ni sprul pa dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la sogs pas bsdus pa rnams ni sprul pa dang mtshungs par te /
translated: The elements that are included in the pure buddhaverse and so on are like emanations.

original: de dag rang gi sems yongs su dag pas sprul pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na nang gi khams drug ni sgyu ma dang @140a * //
analyzed: de dag rang gi sems yongs su dag pas sprul pa'i phyir ro // yang na nang gi khams drug ni sgyu ma dang @140a * //
translated: Because they are emanated by the purity of one's own mind.

original: mtshungs par te /
analyzed: mtshungs par te /
translated: Or else, the six internal elements are like illusions.

original: sems can med kyang sems can la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can med kyang sems can la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, although there are no sentient beings, they appear in the form of sentient beings and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni smig rgyu dang mtshungs par te //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni smig rgyu dang mtshungs par te //
translated: The six consciousness elements and all mental factors are like mirages.

original: de dag smig rgyu bzhin du brdzun pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de dag smig rgyu bzhin du brdzun pa'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because they appear in the form of false objects, like mirages.

original: / phyi'i khams rnams ni rmi lam dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: / phyi'i khams rnams ni rmi lam dang mtshungs par te /
translated: The external elements are like dreams.

original: rmi lam bzhin du gzugs rnams brdzun pa yin yang yul du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam bzhin du gzugs rnams brdzun pa yin yang yul du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like dreams, forms are false, yet appear as objects.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi skur bsdus pa rnams ni mig yor dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyi skur bsdus pa rnams ni mig yor dang mtshungs par te /
translated: The form bodies of the Buddha, which are subsumed in the form body adorned with the major and minor marks of a great being, are like a reflection.

original: yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi sku'i dbang gis de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i chos kyi sku'i dbang gis de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they appear in that way by the power of the completely pure Dharma body.

original: bstan pa'i chos rnams su bsdus pa dag ni brag ca dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos rnams su bsdus pa dag ni brag ca dang mtshungs par te /
translated: The teachings, which are subsumed in the Dharma body, are like an echo.

original: brag ca bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang gis thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brag ca bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang gis thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are obtained by the power of the Bhagavat, like an echo.

original: sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bur bsdus pa rnams ni gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par te ;
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bur bsdus pa rnams ni gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par te ;
translated: Those subsumed in the result of former actions are like a reflection.

original: chos thams cad ni las ji lta ba bzhin du skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni las ji lta ba bzhin du skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are born according to their karma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bsdus pa rnams ni chu zla dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bsdus pa rnams ni chu zla dang mtshungs par te /
translated: Those subsumed in the completely pure buddha field are like the moon in the water.

original: sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams dang bral ba'i sems kyi chu la zla ba bzhin du snang bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i dri ma rnams dang bral ba'i sems kyi chu la zla ba bzhin du snang bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they appear like the moon in the water of the mind free from the stains of obscurations.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ni sprul pa dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad ni sprul pa dang mtshungs par te /
translated: All conditioned things are like magical creations.

original: de dag brdzun pa yin yang ji ltar rang gi rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pas sprul pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag brdzun pa yin yang ji ltar rang gi rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pas sprul pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they are false, magical creations appear due to the aggregation of their own causes and conditions.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i ye shes thob pa las langs nas yang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i ye shes 'byung ba ni rtags yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su zhugs par shes par
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i ye shes thob pa las langs nas yang sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i ye shes 'byung ba ni rtags yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su zhugs par shes par
translated: Thus, when one enters into the sameness of all things, one attains the intuition that is like space. When one rises from that, the intuition that is like a magical creation, etc. is a sign. Therefore, one should understand that one has entered the non-conceptual realm.

original: bya'o // da ni de'i phan yon te bsdus pa'i don bcu gcig pa ni bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bya'o // da ni de'i phan yon te bsdus pa'i don bcu gcig pa ni bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Now, the eleventh summarized topic, the benefit of that, is stated by the line, “great bliss, etc.”

original: ye shes rnam pa 'di gnyis la phan yon rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa 'di gnyis la phan yon rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four benefits to these two kinds of intuition.

original: gong ma gnyis ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis ni bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The first two are from the point of view of the perfection of one’s own aim.

original: 'og ma gnyis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: 'og ma gnyis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa las brtsams pa ste /
translated: The next two are based on the excellence of benefit for others.

original: kha na ma tho ba med cing dam pa mi zad pa'i bde ba la gnas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i dbang thob pas bde ba chen po la gnas pa shin tu rgyas pa yang @140b 'thob po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med cing dam pa mi zad pa'i bde ba la gnas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i dbang thob pas bde ba chen po la gnas pa shin tu rgyas pa yang @140b 'thob po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He attains the great and vast happiness of abiding in great bliss, because he has attained the power to manifest the abiding in the inexhaustible bliss of the holy, which is free of the possibility of wrongdoing.

original: mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi mchog la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par 'byor ba mngon du bya ba'i dbang thob pas sems phun sum tshogs pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa yang 'thob po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa thams cad kyi mchog la sogs pa yon tan gyi khyad par 'byor ba mngon du bya ba'i dbang thob pas sems phun sum tshogs pa chen po shin tu rgyas pa yang 'thob po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He attains the great and vast excellence of mind, because he has attained the power to manifest the mastery of the special qualities such as the highest of all the superknowledges.

original: sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ting nge 'dzin la bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ting nge 'dzin la bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word mind refers to concentration.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pa rnam pa thams cad rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pas shes rab che zhing shin tu rgyas pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / 'jug pa dang / ldog pa rnam pa thams cad rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pas shes rab che zhing shin tu rgyas pa yang 'thob bo //
translated: He attains the great and vast excellence of wisdom, because he is skilled in discerning all the counteragents, antidotes, engagements, and disengagements of all sentient beings.

original: sems can skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa rnams yongs su shes pa 'thob pas na ye shes che zhing shin tu rgyas pa yang 'thob po //
analyzed: sems can skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa rnams yongs su shes pa 'thob pas na ye shes che zhing shin tu rgyas pa yang 'thob po //
translated: And because they attain the knowledge of sentient beings who have good fortune and those who do not have good fortune, they also attain the great and vast knowledge.

original: de dag gi rjes su mthun par rnam pa thams cad du chos bstan pa la 'jug pa'i dbang thob pas bshad pa chen po la dbang ba shin tu rgyas pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su mthun par rnam pa thams cad du chos bstan pa la 'jug pa'i dbang thob pas bshad pa chen po la dbang ba shin tu rgyas pa yang 'thob bo //
translated: And because they attain mastery in teaching the Dharma in all its aspects in accordance with those sentient beings, they also attain the great and vast mastery in teaching.

original: bsdus pa'i don bcu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don bcu gnyis pa ste /
translated: This is the twelfth summary.

original: phan yon rnam pa bzhi po 'di'i las kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa bzhi po 'di'i las kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the activity of these four benefits is stated

original: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ste /
translated: in the verse beginning with “at all times.”

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa yang rgyun mi gcod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa yang rgyun mi gcod do //
translated: Because the effortless deeds of the buddhas are uninterrupted,

original: de'i phyir dus thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don gyi rnam pa thams cad kyang byed nus par 'gyur te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don gyi rnam pa thams cad kyang byed nus par 'gyur te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: therefore they are able to perform all the various kinds of benefit for all sentient beings at all times.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa yang rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bas skal ba ji lta ba bzhin dus thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don gyi rnam pa thams cad mdzad pa grub
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa yang rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bas skal ba ji lta ba bzhin dus thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi don gyi rnam pa thams cad mdzad pa grub
translated: Therefore, when buddhas awaken, they engage in spontaneously present buddha activity that occurs uninterruptedly, so they accomplish all aspects of the benefit of all sentient beings at all times in accordance with their fortune.

original: pa ni de'i las su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ni de'i las su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when the Buddha is attained, the activity of the Buddha is spontaneously accomplished and occurs without interruption. The accomplishment of all the aspects of the aims of all sentient beings at all times in accordance with their fortune is taught as its action.🔽The thirteenth point is the inclusion of all the aspects of the aims of sentient beings in the single sphere of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe nye bar bkod pas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings gcig tu blang ba ste bsdus pa'i don bcu gsum pa ston to //🔽'dir don gnyis bstan te dpe dang dngos po //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe nye bar bkod pas ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings gcig tu blang ba ste bsdus pa'i don bcu gsum pa ston to // 'dir don gnyis bstan te dpe dang dngos po //
translated: This is taught by the example of the wish-fulfilling gem and so on.

original: de la brag la sogs pa ni dpe ste /
analyzed: de la brag la sogs pa ni dpe ste /
translated: The example is the wish-fulfilling gem and so on.

original: 'dis nye bar dpags pas na dpe'o //
analyzed: 'dis nye bar dpags pas na dpe'o //
translated: It is an example because it is inferred from this.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i chos ni dngos so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i chos ni dngos so //
translated: The actual example is the phenomena of affliction and so on.

original: gcig tu mkhregs zhes bya ba ni phrag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu mkhregs zhes bya ba ni phrag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be “one solid mass” because it is without interstices.

original: sra ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu sra pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sra ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu sra pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be “hard” because it is extremely hard.

original: de bas na gang de'i rang bzhin gcig tu mkhregs pa de ni sra ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na gang de'i rang bzhin gcig tu mkhregs pa de ni sra ba ste /
translated: Therefore, that which is one-sidedly hard is solid.

original: gcig tu mkhregs shing sra ba zhes bya'o //🔽'dir rin @141a * //
analyzed: gcig tu mkhregs shing sra ba zhes bya'o // 'dir rin @141a * //
translated: It is called one-sidedly hard and solid.

original: po che'i gter du gyur pas na gter zhes bya'o //
analyzed: po che'i gter du gyur pas na gter zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, it is called a treasure because it is a treasure of jewels.

original: 'od gsal bzhes bya ba ni 'bar ba dang ldan ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal bzhes bya ba ni 'bar ba dang ldan ba'o //
translated: Luminous means radiant.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rigs tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs so //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rigs tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs so //
translated: Various means many different kinds.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsams pa'i don de bzhin du 'grub pa'i rgyur gyur pas so //🔽rko ba'i mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pas /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsams pa'i don de bzhin du 'grub pa'i rgyur gyur pas so // rko ba'i mngon par 'du bya ba med ces bya ba de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pas /
translated: Wish-fulfilling jewel means it is the cause for accomplishing the intended purpose.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa lam gyi dpe'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings su 'jug pa lam gyi dpe'o //
translated: The absence of the activity of digging is the path example of entering the nonconceptual realm through the union of śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: phyug ces bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyug ces bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Wealth means teaching.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa ste /
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: nor che la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nor che la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Great wealth means

original: ji ltar bsags par bya ba'i phyir gser la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsags par bya ba'i phyir gser la sogs pa'o //
translated: Gold, etc. are for the purpose of amassing.

original: longs spyod che bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni kun du spyad pa yo byad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod che bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni kun du spyad pa yo byad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Great enjoyment refers to the enjoyment of all the requisites, etc.

original: 'du byed kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi bye brag ste /
translated: The various kinds of formative influence refers to the different kinds of formative influence.

original: de rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are of various kinds.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnyis la so sor nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnyis la so sor nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi bye brag ste /
translated: Afflicted and situated in duality refers to the particularities of the latter.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdus pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs par bsdus pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: It is afflicted because it is included in the affliction, karma and rebirth which have been active since beginningless time.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa'i mtha' la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa'i mtha' la sogs pa la mngon par chags pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Situated in duality refers to the attachment to the extreme of annihilation and the extreme of permanence, etc.

original: de la so sor nye bar gnas pa ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa rnams dus thams cad du mngon par chags pas na gnyis la so sor nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la so sor nye bar gnas pa ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'jig rten pa rnams dus thams cad du mngon par chags pas na gnyis la so sor nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is situated in two places, because worldly people are always attached to it through the power of ignorance.

original: de la 'du byed kyi bye brag 'di ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag gis byas pa'i phyir snying po med pas na rdo'i ri dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed kyi bye brag 'di ni rang bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i bye brag gis byas pa'i phyir snying po med pas na rdo'i ri dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a stone mountain, because the variety of formative forces is without essence, since it is produced by the variety of conceptual thoughts.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rgyun ma chad par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye bas bsdus pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir gcig dang mkhregs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rgyun ma chad par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye bas bsdus pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir gcig dang mkhregs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a single solid mass, because it is defiled by the defilements, karma and rebirth, which have been operating in an unbroken continuum from beginningless time.

original: mtha' gnyis thams cad la mngon par chags pa ni sangs rgyas ma byung bar dbral dka' bas na gnyis la so sor nye bar gnas pa ni sra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis thams cad la mngon par chags pa ni sangs rgyas ma byung bar dbral dka' bas na gnyis la so sor nye bar gnas pa ni sra ba lta bu'o //

original: 'di btags pa'i yod pa la skur na skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di btags pa'i yod pa la skur na skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' 'gyur ro //
translated: If one denies the conventional existence of these, one falls into the extreme of denial.

original: yod par 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba ni med par 'dzin pa yin pas de ltar rtog na yod par 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod par 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba ni med par 'dzin pa yin pas de ltar rtog na yod par 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the apprehension of non-existence precedes the apprehension of existence, if one conceives in that way, it is just the apprehension of existence.

original: de bas na gzugs med ces kyang brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs med ces kyang brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not conceive that it is non-existent.

original: rgyur yang med ces bya ba ni rgyu'i ngo bor med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur yang med ces bya ba ni rgyu'i ngo bor med pa'o //
translated: As for the statement “it does not exist as a cause,” it does not exist in the nature of a cause.

original: 'bras bur yang med ces bya ba ni 'bus bur gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bur yang med ces bya ba ni 'bus bur gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: As for the statement “it does not exist as an effect,” it does not exist as something that becomes an effect.

original: las ni rang gi 'bras bu 'phen nus pa'o //
analyzed: las ni rang gi 'bras bu 'phen nus pa'o //
translated: An action is that which is able to project its own effect.

original: ldan pa ni rang gi 'bras bu la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni rang gi 'bras bu la sogs pa dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: Possession is the connection with one’s own effect and so on.

original: 'jug pa ni rab tu tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni rab tu tha dad pa'o //
translated: Engagement is the distinction.

original: gzugs su snang ba rnam par rig pa yang don dam par ma skyes pas de yang gzugs bzhin du brdzun pa'i phyir de bas na gzugs la rnam par rig pa tsam du mngon par chags pa 'di yang sgro btags pa'i mtha' yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba rnam par rig pa yang don dam par ma skyes pas de yang gzugs bzhin du brdzun pa'i phyir de bas na gzugs la rnam par rig pa tsam du mngon par chags pa 'di yang sgro btags pa'i mtha' yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the appearance of form as an awareness is ultimately unarisen, it is also false, like form. Therefore, in order to demonstrate that this attachment to mere awareness in regard to form is also an extreme of superimposition, he says

original: rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “mere awareness” and so on.

original: kun rdzob tu rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs snang ba'i rnam par rig pa gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun rdzob tu rnam par rig pa la skur na skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs snang ba'i rnam par rig pa gnas pa'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun rdzob tu rnam par rig pa la skur na skur pa 'debs pa'i mthar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: In the conventional, it is like a dream, etc., because the consciousness that appears as form abides. Thus, in the conventional, if one denigrates consciousness, one falls into the extreme of nihilism.

original: de ltar mtha' gnyis bstan nas da ni dbu ma'i lam du 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu dag 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar mtha' gnyis bstan nas da ni dbu ma'i lam du 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu dag 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus taught the two extremes, now, in order to teach the entry into the middle path, he says, “O sons of noble family, it is thus, etc.”

original: gang gis don dam par dpyad na /
analyzed: gang gis don dam par dpyad na /
translated: By whom, when investigating the ultimate,

original: rnal 'byor pas gzugs mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas gzugs mi dmigs te /
translated: the yogi does not observe form,

original: gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa yang mi dmigs pa de'i phyir 'di la sgro 'dogs par mi byed do zhes bya ba tshig gi rjes so //
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa yang mi dmigs pa de'i phyir 'di la sgro 'dogs par mi byed do zhes bya ba tshig gi rjes so //
translated: and also does not observe the consciousness that appears as form, therefore, one should not superimpose anything here.

original: skur ba'i mtha' la yang mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: skur ba'i mtha' la yang mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: One should not adhere to the extreme of nihilism either.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi @143b thams cad du chud gson pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi @143b thams cad du chud gson pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that all consciousnesses are completely annihilated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa chud mi gzon to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa chud mi gzon to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the consciousness of form, etc. is not lost.

original: gzhan du na mthong ba la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na mthong ba la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict seeing, etc.

original: rnam par rig pa ma gtogs par chos gang yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba na 'dir rnam par rig pa'i sgra ni thams cad du 'khrul pa la dgongs te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ma gtogs par chos gang yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba na 'dir rnam par rig pa'i sgra ni thams cad du 'khrul pa la dgongs te /
translated: When it is said that “apart from consciousness no dharma is apprehended,” the word “consciousness” here is intended to refer to all error.

original: phyin ci log gi don ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi don ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches the meaning of error.

original: de bas na chos thams cad ni 'khrul pa tsam gyis brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bor zad de /
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad ni 'khrul pa tsam gyis brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bor zad de /
translated: Therefore, all dharmas are exhausted in the nature of the mere imagination of what is unreal.🔽Apart from that, there is no intrinsic reality of their continuum.

original: de ma gtogs par de dag gi rang bzhin rang gi rgyud ni gang yang med do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma gtogs par de dag gi rang bzhin rang gi rgyud ni gang yang med do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus it is intended.

original: de skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las kyang /
translated: In the same way, the noble Laṅkâvatāra says,

original: dngos po skye ba kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: dngos po skye ba kun rdzob tu //
translated: The origination of things is conventional.

original: dam pa'i don du rang bzhin med //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du rang bzhin med //
translated: In ultimate truth, they have no intrinsic reality.

original: rang bzhin med pa gang bor ba //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa gang bor ba //
translated: That which is devoid of intrinsic reality

original: de ni yang dag kun rdzob 'dod //
analyzed: de ni yang dag kun rdzob 'dod //
translated: is held to be the real conventional.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: de lta bas na dngos po thams cad ni kun rdzob tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po thams cad ni kun rdzob tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, all things are taught as conventional.

original: des na rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi thams cad du chud gzon pa ma yin par bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi thams cad du chud gzon pa ma yin par bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is established that all consciousnesses are not completely lost.

original: rnam par rig pa de yang dngos po med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings dang kun rdzob kyi ngo bo'i rnam par rig pa mi 'dra bar dgag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de yang dngos po med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings dang kun rdzob kyi ngo bo'i rnam par rig pa mi 'dra bar dgag pa ste /
translated: This consciousness is not seen as a non-entity. This shows that the realm of phenomena and the consciousness of conventional nature are not the same.

original: chos dang gang zag gi dngos po dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings la 'dir dngos po med pa'i sgrar gsungs te /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag gi dngos po dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings la 'dir dngos po med pa'i sgrar gsungs te /
translated: The nature of the realm of phenomena, which is free from the entities of phenomena and persons, is called a non-entity here.

original: chos dang gang zag gi dngos por sgro btags pa'i rnam par rig pa'i bdag gi ngo bo dang de gnyis mi 'dra ba ni rigs te /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag gi dngos por sgro btags pa'i rnam par rig pa'i bdag gi ngo bo dang de gnyis mi 'dra ba ni rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that the nature of the self of consciousness, which is superimposed with the entities of phenomena and persons, is not the same as that.

original: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa gnyis 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the real and the unreal are contradictory.

original: shin tu mi 'dra ba yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: shin tu mi 'dra ba yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: It is also not right to say that they are very different.

original: rnam par rig pa ma gtogs par dngos po med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ma gtogs par dngos po med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He does not see any entity apart from the representation of consciousness.

original: rnam par rig pa de nyid la chos dang gang zag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa de nyid la chos dang gang zag med pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The characteristic of the nonexistence of the personal entity and the dharmas in that representation of consciousness is the dharma-dhātu.

original: de chos nyid du gdags pa'i phyir chos dang chos can don dam par mi 'dra ba med pas shin tu mi 'dra ba yang ma yin no //🔽chos kyi dbyings de dang rnam par rig pa de gcig par yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni thams cad la rnam @144a * //
analyzed: de chos nyid du gdags pa'i phyir chos dang chos can don dam par mi 'dra ba med pas shin tu mi 'dra ba yang ma yin no // chos kyi dbyings de dang rnam par rig pa de gcig par yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni thams cad la rnam @144a * //
translated: Since it is designated as the ultimate reality, the dharma and the dharmin are not ultimately different, so they are not very different.

original: par rig pa lta bu yin na ni de yang mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par rig pa lta bu yin na ni de yang mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not see that the representation of consciousness and the dharma-dhātu are the same, because if everything were like the representation of consciousness, the error would arise that it would be directly perceived.

original: des na thams cad kyis de kho na mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi dbyings bzhin du rnam par rig pa yang bden par 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rig pa bzhin du chos kyi dbyings de yang 'dus byas dang /
analyzed: des na thams cad kyis de kho na mthong bar 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi dbyings bzhin du rnam par rig pa yang bden par 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par rig pa bzhin du chos kyi dbyings de yang 'dus byas dang /
translated: Therefore, it would follow that everyone would perceive reality,🔽it would follow that consciousness would be real like the dharmadhātu,🔽it would follow that the dharmadhātu would be afflicted,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽chos kyi dbyings dang rnam par rig pa gnyis tha dad par yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong pa ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // chos kyi dbyings dang rnam par rig pa gnyis tha dad par yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong pa ni /
translated: and it would follow that the dharmadhātu would be compounded and afflicted, and so on, just as consciousness is.🔽Not seeing the dharmadhātu and consciousness as different🔽If the dharmadhātu is the absence of consciousness, how could it be different from consciousness?

original: rnam par rig pa nyid du kun rdzob kyi ngo bo chos dang gang zag tu sgro btags pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings yin na ji ltar de de dang tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa nyid du kun rdzob kyi ngo bo chos dang gang zag tu sgro btags pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi dbyings yin na ji ltar de de dang tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: If the dharmadhātu is the absence of consciousness, how could it be different from consciousness?

original: gal te tha dad par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe'i 'du byed kyi bdag med pa tsam nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te tha dad par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe'i 'du byed kyi bdag med pa tsam nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were different, then the mere selflessness of compounded things would not be the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: 'du byed kyi mtshan mas bcings pa rnams kyang rnal 'byor pas zil gyis non par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mtshan mas bcings pa rnams kyang rnal 'byor pas zil gyis non par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And those bound by the characteristics of compounded things would not be overcome by the yogin,

original: de de dang tha dad pas chos kyi dbyings gzhan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de dang tha dad pas chos kyi dbyings gzhan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he would realize the dharma-dhātu to be different from it.

original: de lta bas na dung la sogs pa dang dkar po la sogs pa bzhin du gcig dang tha dad par brjod du med pa nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings so //
analyzed: de lta bas na dung la sogs pa dang dkar po la sogs pa bzhin du gcig dang tha dad par brjod du med pa nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings so //
translated: Therefore, like a conch and its whiteness, the nondiscriminated realm is inexpressible as either the same or different.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid med pa de la dngos por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid med pa de la dngos por yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
translated: The characteristic of the dharma-dhātu is not seen as an entity,

original: de la yod pa'i ngo bo gang yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yod pa'i ngo bo gang yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no essence of it is perceived.

original: dngos po med par yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir de rnam par bcad pas 'thob pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med par yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni dngos po mi dmigs pa'i phyir de rnam par bcad pas 'thob pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, one does not see non-entity, because the entity is not perceived. By eliminating that, one does not attain the non-entity nature, because it does not exist.

original: yod pa las gzhan pa ni med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas yong pa ma grub na de yang ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: yod pa las gzhan pa ni med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas yong pa ma grub na de yang ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: Since the characteristic of non-existence is other than existence, when existence is not established, that is also not established.

original: dper na / gal te yod pa ma grub na //
analyzed: dper na / gal te yod pa ma grub na //
translated: For example, it is explained:🔽If existence is not established,

original: med pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te //🔽yod las gzhan pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: med pa 'grub par mi 'gyur te // yod las gzhan pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: non-existence is not established.🔽People say

original: med pa'o zhes skye bo smra //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: med pa'o zhes skye bo smra // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: that a thing other than existence is non-existence.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gang rnam par ma brtags pa de rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings so zhes de ltar lta na yang rnam par rtog pa la kun du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gang rnam par ma brtags pa de rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings so zhes de ltar lta na yang rnam par rtog pa la kun du spyod pa ste /
translated: If one sees in that way, “That which is not imagined by any conceptualization is the non-conceptual realm,” then one engages in conceptualization.

original: de lta @144b bas na de ltar yang mi blta'o //
analyzed: de lta @144b bas na de ltar yang mi blta'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not see in that way.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ces bya ba ni skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “All conceptual thoughts” refers to conceptual thoughts such as “non-arising” and “non-cessation.”

original: 'di ni 'jug pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i thabs mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jug pa'i tshul zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i thabs mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: This is called “the method of engagement” because it is the method of engagement that is characterized by the avoidance of the two extremes.

original: mtha' gnyis la ji ltar brtag pa ni gong du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la ji ltar brtag pa ni gong du bstan pa yin no //
translated: How the two extremes are to be examined has been taught above.

original: de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i dbyings la rab tu gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, one abides in the non-conceptual realm.

original: ji ltar dbu ma'i lam du 'jug pa'i tshul so sor brtag pa brten pa de ltar de la rab tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma'i lam du 'jug pa'i tshul so sor brtag pa brten pa de ltar de la rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: Just as one relies on the examination of the method of engagement in the middle way, one abides in that.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams la yang de bzhin du brtag ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rnams la yang de bzhin du brtag ste /
translated: One should examine feeling, etc., in the same way.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis la so sor btags pa dang dbu ma'i lam du 'jug pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis la so sor btags pa dang dbu ma'i lam du 'jug pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The two extremes of superimposition and denial are to be examined individually, and the method of engagement in the middle way is to be examined.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir gzugs bzhin du ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir gzugs bzhin du ste /
translated: Because of similarity, like form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdus nas sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsdus nas sbyor ba'o //
translated: Similarly, feeling and so on is a collective application.

original: ji ltar sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyor zhe na /
translated: How is it applied?

original: tshig gi mtha' nas gzung ste sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig gi mtha' nas gzung ste sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is applied from the end of the word,

original: rigs kyi bu dag 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag 'di la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the statement Sons of noble family, in this regard and so on is made.

original: 'khrul pas sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pas gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad ni don dam par spang du med de /
analyzed: 'khrul pas sgro btags pa'i ngo bo yin pas gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad ni don dam par spang du med de /
translated: Since they have the nature of superimposition through error, all obscurations such as afflictions are ultimately not to be abandoned, because they are primordially unborn.

original: mgo lan gnyis su gcad du med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mgo lan gnyis su gcad du med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like how one cannot cut off one's head twice.

original: de bas na spang bar bya ba med pas thams cad mkhyen pa ni spang ba'i phyir ma yin pas na 'di yang sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' yin pas rnal 'byor pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na spang bar bya ba med pas thams cad mkhyen pa ni spang ba'i phyir ma yin pas na 'di yang sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' yin pas rnal 'byor pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since there is nothing to be abandoned, omniscience is not for the sake of abandoning [afflictions]. Thus, this is also an extreme of superimposition, so it should be abandoned by the yogi.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gcig tu rnam par byang ba'o zhes spyod na yang rnam par rtog pa nyid de //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gcig tu rnam par byang ba'o zhes spyod na yang rnam par rtog pa nyid de //
translated: Similarly, if one engages in the thought that omniscience is exclusively purified, that is also a conceptualization.

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it grasps the two extremes of purity and impurity.

original: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par byang ba'o zhes 'dzin pa'i shugs kyis gzhan dag la yongs su ma dag pa'o zhes sgro 'dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par byang ba'o zhes 'dzin pa'i shugs kyis gzhan dag la yongs su ma dag pa'o zhes sgro 'dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: In that way, by the force of grasping “the purification of omniscience,” others will superimpose “impurity.”

original: de ni de la ltos pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni de la ltos pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because that is dependent on that.

original: / de bas na gnyis su rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de bas na gnyis su rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there is the conception of duality.

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang ro gcig pa la dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs pa dbyer med bas de bas rnal 'byor pas rnam par rtog pa 'di yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang ro gcig pa la dag pa dang ma dag pa la sogs pa dbyer med bas de bas rnal 'byor pas rnam par rtog pa 'di yang mi bya ste /
translated: Since the non-arisen and the single taste of all phenomena are inseparable from purity and impurity, etc., the yogi/nī should not make this conceptual distinction.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yod ces med ces gnyi ga mtha' //
analyzed: yod ces med ces gnyi ga mtha' //
translated: Existence and non-existence are both extremes.

original: dag dang ma dag @145a * //
analyzed: dag dang ma dag @145a * //
translated: Purity and impurity

original: 'di yang mtha' //
analyzed: 'di yang mtha' //
translated: are also extremes.

original: de bas mtha' gnyis rnam spangs te //
analyzed: de bas mtha' gnyis rnam spangs te //
translated: Therefore, having abandoned the two extremes,

translated: “Supreme” is because it is superior to mundane and supramundane bliss.

analyzed: dbang byed ces bya ba ni ji ltar 'dod pa dang / ji srid du 'dod pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is the mastery” means that one can actualize whatever one wishes, for as long as one wishes.

translated: “It is equal and unequal” means

analyzed: @145b yang na chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa thob pas na mnyam pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is equal because it is attained through the realization of the equality of all things.

analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i bde ba'i mchog gzhan med pas na mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: It is unequal because there is no other bliss equal to it.

analyzed: yang na rab tu zhi bas mnyam pa'o //

analyzed: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas mi mnyam pa'o // rnam par mi rtog pa nyid bde ba'am ;

translated: that it is the bliss of the nonconceptual or the bliss which is the result of the nonconceptual.

analyzed: thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: Attains means realizes.

translated: By this having said this, the compiler shows that this dhāraṇī is suitable to be taught as a prophecy, since it is a repetition of the Bhagavān's words.

translated: By this explanation of the non-conceptual dhāraṇī,

translated: Whatever great virtue I, of little intelligence, have obtained,🔽May that, having exhausted the darkness of various faults of bad mind,
